     622             : char*
     623           0 : summarize_template_param_type_kind_in_string (a_template_param_type_kind kind)
     624             :    {
     625             : #if 0
     626             :   tpck_param,           /* The template param constant represents a simple non-type template parameter, e.g., for I in the following:
     627             :                              template <int I> class A {
     628             :                                int a[I];
     629             :                              };
     630             :                            This is the most common and obvious case. */
     631             :   tpck_expression,      /* The template param constant represents an expression, e.g., for I+1 in the following:
     632             :                              template <int I> class A {
     633             :                                static char s[I+1];
     634             :                              };
     635             :                              template <int I> char A<I>::s[I+1] = { 0 }; */
     636             :   tpck_member,          /* The template param constant represents a member of a tk_template_param class, e.g., for T::k in the following:
     637             :                              template <class T> class A {
     638             :                                int a[T::k];
     639             :                              };
     640             :                            Represents the "value" of the member; see also tpck_address. */
     641             :   tpck_unknown_function,
     642             :                         /* Represents the address of an unknown function called in a template context where overload
     643             :                            resolution cannot be done (e.g., because the argument types involve template parameters).
     644             :                            "address" really means "an rvalue for the function," which has unknown type and might therefore be a
     645             :                            pointer or a pointer to member. */
     646             :   tpck_address,         /* Used, pointing to a tpck_member constant, to indicate the address of the indicated member. */
     647             :   tpck_sizeof,          /* The template param constant represents the sizeof operator applied to a type or expression that
     648             :                            contains a template parameter type. */
     649             :   tpck_alignof,         /* The template param constant represents the __ALIGNOF__ operator applied to a type or
     650             :                            expression that contains a template parameter type. */
     651             :   tpck_uuidof,          /* The template param constant represents the Microsoft __uuidof operator applied to a type
     652             :                            that contains a template parameter type.  It represents the address of the implied structure. */
     653             :   tpck_typeid,          /* The template param constant represents the typeid operator applied to a type or expression that
     654             :                            contains a template parameter type.  It represents the address of the implied std::type_info
     655             :                            structure.  (Only used when typeid is used for a nontype template argument; e.g. "X<&typeid(Y)>".)*/
     656             :   tpck_noexcept,        /* The template param constant represents the noexcept operator applied to an expression that
     657             :                            contains a template parameter type. */
     658             :   tpck_template_ref,    /* The template param constant provides the address of an unknown function template, and a set of
     659             :                            explicit template arguments for that template. Very similar to tpck_unknown_function, and likewise
     660             :                            represents an rvalue for the function, which has unknown type and might therefore be a pointer or a
     661             :                            pointer to member. */
     662             :   tpck_integer_pack,    /* The template param constant represents a dependent "__integer_pack(N)..." construct. */
     663             :   tpck_destructor       /* The template param constant represents a destructor of a nonreal class. */
     664             : #endif
     665             : 
     666           0 :      char* s = NULL;
     667             : 
     668           0 :      switch (kind)
     669             :         {
     670             :           case tpck_param:            s = (char*)"tpck_param";            break;
     671           0 :           case tpck_expression:       s = (char*)"tpck_expression";       break;
     672           0 :           case tpck_member:           s = (char*)"tpck_member";           break;
     673           0 :           case tpck_unknown_function: s = (char*)"tpck_unknown_function"; break;
     674             : #if ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER < 5

     676             : #endif

     820             :   sk_member_function,   /* Member function of a class. */

    1327             :                         /* No encoding prefix */
    1328             : #define SCLK_UTF8_LITERAL       0x02
    1329             :                         /* u8"..." */
    1330             : #define SCLK_CHAR16_T_LITERAL   0x03
    1331             :                         /* u"..." or u'x' */
    1332             : #define SCLK_CHAR32_T_LITERAL   0x04

    1335             :                         /* L"..." or L'x' */

    1337             :                         /* R"...", u8R"...", uR"xxx", or UR"..." */
    1338             : #define SCLK_STRING_LITERAL     0x10
    1339             :                         /* TRUE for string literal, FALSE for char literal */
    1340             : 
    1341             : /* A convenient name for a narrow non-raw string literal: */

    3632             :   a_type_ptr    class_type;
    3633             :                         /* The "proxy" class type associated with a given
    3634             :                            template parameter.  This becomes useful in name
    3635             :                            lookup if a template parameter is used in a way
    3636             :                            requiring it to be a class with members --
    3637             :                            e.g.,
    3638             :                              template <class T> void f(T::X);
    3639             :                            Here we know T must represent a class type
    3640             :                            with a member type X, and the X can be
    3641             :                            entered in a scope associated with T.  In such
    3642             :                            contexts the class pointed to by class_type is
    3643             :                            used in place of the type that points to the
    3644             :                            template parameter.  The class-qualified
    3645             :                            lookup is done using class_type.  The first
    3646             :                            time a name is looked up in class_type it
    3647             :                            will be entered as a member that can be
    3648             :                            found by subsequent lookups.  The pointer is
    3649             :                            NULL if no class use has been encountered.  A
    3650             :                            proxy class is also created for C++/CLI
    3651             :                            generics to represent the type specified by
    3652             :                            the constraints. */

    4022             :    {
    4023             : #if 0
    4024             : #define DM_NONE         ((a_decl_modifier)0x0)
    4025             :                         /* No decl modifiers. */
    4026             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4027             : #define DM_DLLIMPORT    ((a_decl_modifier)(1 << (int)dmt_dllimport))
    4028             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration includes the
    4029             :                            Microsoft __declspec(dllimport) specifier. */
    4030             : #define DM_DLLEXPORT    ((a_decl_modifier)(1 << (int)dmt_dllexport))
    4031             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration includes the
    4032             :                            Microsoft __declspec(dllexport) specifier. */
    4033             : #define DM_DLLFLAGS     (DM_DLLIMPORT | DM_DLLEXPORT)
    4034             :                         /* Convenience macro to select DLL-related flags. */
    4035             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4036             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_SPECIFIER_ALLOWED
    4037             : #define DM_THREAD       ((a_decl_modifier)(1 << (int)dmt_thread))
    4038             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration includes the __thread or
    4039             :                            __declspec(thread) specifier. */
    4040             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_SPECIFIER_... */
    4041             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4042             : #define DM_MICROSOFT_INLINE                                             \

    4045             :                            Microsoft __inline specifier. */

    4048             :                            Microsoft __forceinline specifier. */

    4165             : void
    4166           0 : summarize_variable ( a_variable_ptr ptr )
    4167             :    {
    4168             : #if 0
    4169             :   a_source_correspondence
    4170             :                 source_corresp;
    4171             :                         /* Information on any source entity that corresponds
    4172             :                            to this entity. */
    4173             :   a_variable_ptr
    4174             :                 next;
    4175             :                         /* Pointer to the next variable declared in the same
    4176             :                            scope, NULL if this variable is the last in the
    4177             :                            scope. */
    4178             :   a_type_ptr    type;
    4179             :                         /* Type of the variable. */
    4180             :   a_param_type_ptr
    4181             :                 assoc_param_type;
    4182             :                         /* If is_parameter is TRUE and is_this_parameter is
    4183             :                            FALSE, points to the associated a_param_type entry.
    4184             :                            NULL otherwise. */
    4185             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
    4186             :                         /* Left NULL for implicit parameters added by IL
    4187             :                            lowering. */
    4188             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
    4189             :   a_storage_class
    4190             :                 storage_class;
    4191             :                         /* Storage class.  The storage class is not necessarily
    4192             :                            what was written in the source program; it is
    4193             :                            standardized to show the effective storage class
    4194             :                            rather than the keyword that appeared. */
    4195             :                         /* Note that the C concept of "storage class" is used
    4196             :                            also in C++.  Other C++ uses of a storage class
    4197             :                            are not reflected in this field.  "static" on a
    4198             :                            class member, for example, is a storage class
    4199             :                            syntactically, but has a different effect, which
    4200             :                            is represented elsewhere (e.g., in the use of
    4201             :                            a field for a nonstatic data member and a variable
    4202             :                            for a static data member). */
    4203             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    4204             :   a_storage_class
    4205             :                 declared_storage_class;
    4206             :                         /* The storage class that explicitly appears in the
    4207             :                            source when the variable is defined; sc_unspecified
    4208             :                            if the definition has no explicit storage class
    4209             :                            (including a variable representing a static data
    4210             :                            member) or if there is no definition in the current
    4211             :                            translation unit (if there are only C "tentative
    4212             :                            definitions", the first is treated as a definition
    4213             :                            in this context).  For a declaration that is not a
    4214             :                            definition, the declared storage class is recorded
    4215             :                            in the a_src_seq_secondary_decl entry associated
    4216             :                            with that declaration. */
    4217             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    4218             : #if DECL_MODIFIERS_IN_USE
    4219             :   a_decl_modifier
    4220             :                 decl_modifiers;
    4221             :                         /* Additional declaration information supplied by
    4222             :                            nonstandard language features such as the
    4223             :                            Microsoft storage-class-like __declspec
    4224             :                            modifiers. */
    4225             : #endif /* DECL_MODIFIERS_IN_USE */
    4226             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED ||          \
    4227             :     NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED
    4228             :   union {
    4229             :     char        *name;
    4230             :                         /* If non-NULL, and asm_name_is_valid is TRUE
    4231             :                            this is the name to be used as an assembly
    4232             :                            language level symbol for this variable. */
    4233             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4234             :     a_named_register
    4235             :                 reg;
    4236             :                         /* If both has_named_register_storage_class and
    4237             :                            asm_name_is_valid are FALSE, the register
    4238             :                            to which this variable should be assigned. */
    4239             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4240             : #if NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED
    4241             :     a_named_register_id
    4242             :                 id;
    4243             :                         /* If has_named_register_storage_class is TRUE, the
    4244             :                            id of the register in which this variable is
    4245             :                            stored. */
    4246             : #endif /* NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED */
    4247             :   } asm_name_or_reg;
    4248             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED || ... */
    4249             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || \
    4250             :     USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING
    4251             :   a_targ_alignment
    4252             :                 alignment;
    4253             :                         /* The explicit alignment specified for the
    4254             :                            variable, or zero if there was no explicit
    4255             :                            alignment. */
    4256             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || ... */
    4257             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    4258             : #if GNU_INIT_PRIORITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
    4259             :   a_gnu_init_priority
    4260             :                 init_priority;
    4261             :                         /* The initialization priority specified by the GNU
    4262             :                            attribute "init_priority."  This value should lie
    4263             :                            between 101 and 65535 inclusive, or should be zero
    4264             :                            if the attribute was not specified. */
    4265             : #endif /* GNU_INIT_PRIORITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
    4266             :   a_routine_ptr
    4267             :                 cleanup_routine;
    4268             :                         /* The cleanup routine that should be called when the
    4269             :                            variable (which must be an automatic variable) goes
    4270             :                            out of scope.  (Currently, the front end does not
    4271             :                            make that call explicit in any way.) */
    4272             : #if GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED
    4273             :   a_bit_field   ELF_visibility:3;
    4274             :                         /* The visibility of the variable in the generated
    4275             :                            ELF object code. */
    4276             : #endif /* GNU_VISIBILITY_ATTRIBUTE_ALLOWED */
    4277             :   a_bit_field   is_weak:1;
    4278             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was declared with the
    4279             :                            weak or weakref attribute. */
    4280             :   a_bit_field   is_weakref:1;
    4281             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was declared with the 
    4282             :                            weakref attribute.*/
    4283             :   a_bit_field   is_gnu_alias:1;
    4284             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was declared with the
    4285             :                            alias attribute. */
    4286             :   a_bit_field   has_gnu_unused_attribute:1;
    4287             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was declared with the
    4288             :                            GNU "unused" attribute. */
    4289             :   a_bit_field   has_gnu_used_attribute:1;
    4290             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was declared with the
    4291             :                            GNU "used" attribute. */
    4292             :   a_bit_field   is_not_common:1;
    4293             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was marked with the GNU
    4294             :                            "nocommon" attribute, which indicates is should not
    4295             :                            be placed in "COMMON" (or an equivalent) storage
    4296             :                            (even if it has a "tentative definition").
    4297             :                            Note that GCC appears to ignore the attribute in
    4298             :                            many cases (e.g., in C++): This flag is TRUE even
    4299             :                            in those cases -- it only indicates that the
    4300             :                            attribute appeared. */
    4301             :   a_bit_field   is_common:1;
    4302             :                         /* TRUE if this variable was marked with the GNU
    4303             :                            "common" attribute. */
    4304             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    4305             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED
    4306             :   a_bit_field   asm_name_is_valid:1;
    4307             :                         /* TRUE if the name field of asm_name_or_reg
    4308             :                            is valid; FALSE if the reg field is valid. */
    4309             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED */
    4310             : #if NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED
    4311             :   a_bit_field   has_named_register_storage_class:1;
    4312             :                         /* TRUE if the id field of asm_name_or_reg is
    4313             :                            valid, which indicates that the variable was
    4314             :                            declared with an Embedded C (TR 18037) named
    4315             :                            register storage class. */
    4316             : #endif /* NAMED_REGISTERS_ALLOWED */
    4317             :   a_bit_field   address_taken:1;
    4318             :                         /* TRUE if the address of this variable has been
    4319             :                            taken somewhere. */
    4320             :   a_bit_field   is_parameter:1;
    4321             :                         /* TRUE if this is a parameter of a function. */
    4322             :   a_bit_field   referenced_non_locally:1;
    4323             :                         /* TRUE if the variable is a local static variable
    4324             :                            that is referenced from outside of its function
    4325             :                            (e.g., from a member function of a local class).
    4326             :                            TRUE only in C++. */
    4327             :   a_bit_field   modified_within_try_block:1;
    4328             :                         /* TRUE if the variable is a local variable that is
    4329             :                            modified within a try block and declared in a scope
    4330             :                            containing that try block.  This flag enables a
    4331             :                            back end to treat such variables as requiring
    4332             :                            immediate store after a modification.  C++ only. */
    4333             :   a_bit_field   is_template_static_data_member:1;
    4334             :                         /* TRUE if this is a static data member that is a
    4335             :                            member of a class generated from a template,
    4336             :                            including both the case where the static data member
    4337             :                            is generated from the template and the case where a
    4338             :                            specialization of the static data member is
    4339             :                            provided by the user.  FALSE for all other cases,
    4340             :                            including a static data member of a class that
    4341             :                            is a specialization of a template class. */
    4342             :   a_bit_field   is_prototype_instantiation:1;
    4343             :                         /* TRUE if this variable represents the prototype
    4344             :                            instantiation of a static data member of
    4345             :                            a class template. */
    4346             :   a_bit_field   is_specialized:1;
    4347             :                         /* TRUE when is_template_static_data_member is TRUE
    4348             :                            but the definition is supplied independently of
    4349             :                            the template with which it is associated.  This
    4350             :                            flag may be set as a result of a specialization
    4351             :                            declaration (either an old-style declaration or
    4352             :                            one using the template<> syntax), or if the static
    4353             :                            data member was specified in a do-not-instantiate
    4354             :                            pragma. */
    4355             :   a_bit_field   specialized_with_old_syntax:1;
    4356             :                         /* TRUE if is_specialized is TRUE but the static
    4357             :                            data member was not explicitly declared with the
    4358             :                            template<> syntax. */
    4359             :   a_bit_field   explicit_instantiation:1;
    4360             :                         /* TRUE if an instantiation has been explicitly
    4361             :                            requested using an explicit instantiation directive
    4362             :                            or an instantiation pragma. */
    4363             :   a_bit_field   class_explicitly_instantiated:1;
    4364             :                         /* TRUE if the instantiation request specified the
    4365             :                            class (meaning that all its members should be
    4366             :                            instantiated). */
    4367             :   a_bit_field   explicit_do_not_instantiate:1;
    4368             :                         /* TRUE if instantiation has been explicitly 
    4369             :                            suppressed by an "extern template" directive or
    4370             :                            a do_not_instantiate pragma. */
    4371             : #if AUTOMATIC_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATION
    4372             :   a_bit_field   can_be_instantiated:1;
    4373             :                         /* TRUE if this is a template static data member
    4374             :                            that could be instantiated by this compilation.
    4375             :                            FALSE if is_template_static_data_member is FALSE.
    4376             :                            This flag is provided in the IL so that a
    4377             :                            back end can pass the information along to
    4378             :                            a link-time automatic instantiation mechanism.
    4379             :                            The flag is only set very late in the compilation
    4380             :                            process and should not be relied upon for any
    4381             :                            other purpose. */
    4382             :   a_bit_field   do_not_instantiate:1;
    4383             :                         /* TRUE if a do_not_instantiate pragma was present
    4384             :                            for this template static data member.
    4385             :                            FALSE if is_template_static_data_member is FALSE.
    4386             :                            This flag is provided in the IL so that a
    4387             :                            back end can pass the information along to
    4388             :                            a link-time automatic instantiation mechanism.
    4389             :                            The flag is only set very late in the compilation
    4390             :                            process and should not be relied upon for any
    4391             :                            other purpose. */
    4392             :   a_bit_field   instance_required:1;
    4393             :                         /* TRUE for a static data member of a
    4394             :                            template class for which a definition (either
    4395             :                            template generated or a specific definition)
    4396             :                            must be supplied in this compilation unit or in
    4397             :                            another compilation unit with which this unit
    4398             :                            will be linked.  Implies that the static data
    4399             :                            member is referenced in this compilation.
    4400             :                            FALSE if is_template_static_data_member is FALSE.
    4401             :                            This flag is provided in the IL so that a
    4402             :                            back end can pass the information along to
    4403             :                            a link-time automatic instantiation mechanism.
    4404             :                            The flag is only set very late in the compilation
    4405             :                            process and should not be relied upon for any
    4406             :                            other purpose. */
    4407             : #endif /* AUTOMATIC_TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATION */

    4551             :                            another construct with associated source sequence
    4552             :                            entries.  For example:
    4553             :                              int x[sizeof(struct S { int i; })];

    4557             :                            the non-autonomous struct S are considered to be

    4672             :                            NULL if there is no defining declaration.  When
    4673             :                            is_parameter is TRUE, the type is what actually

    4705             :

    6054             :                            definition.  #pragma pack directives inside the
    6055             :                            template definition appear in the generated code
    6056             :                            but do not have associated a_pragma IL entries, so
    6057             :                            the C++-generating back end cannot track their

    6059             :                            instantiation, allows it to re-sync after

    6124             : 
    6125             : void
    6126           0 : summarize_template_parameter ( a_template_parameter_ptr ptr )
    6127             :    {
    6128             :   // Description of a template parameter (type, nontype or template).  A list
    6129             :   // of such items can be assembled through the "next" pointers and should
    6130             :   // normally be headed by a_template_decl entry. 
    6131             : 
    6132             :   // Information on the source entity that corresponds to this entity.
    6133             :   //      a_source_correspondence source_corresp;

    6152           0 :              {

    6187             : void
    6188           0 : summarize_src_seq_secondary_decl(a_src_seq_secondary_decl_ptr sec_decl)
    6189             :    {
    6190             : #if 0
    6191             :   a_source_position
    6192             :                 decl_position;
    6193             :                         /* Source position of the declaration.  (The source
    6194             :                            position of the entity itself records where the
    6195             :                            primary declaration appeared.) */
    6196             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6197             :   a_decl_position_supplement_ptr
    6198             :                 decl_pos_info;
    6199             :                         /* Points to a block containing additional source
    6200             :                            position information about the declaration.
    6201             :                            May be NULL. */
    6202             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6203             :   a_tagged_pointer
    6204             :                 entity;
    6205             :                         /* Entry identifying the kind of entity (type,
    6206             :                            function, static data member, etc.) for which this
    6207             :                            is the secondary declaration. */
    6208             :   a_type_ptr    declared_type;
    6209             :                         /* The type of the entity, as specified in the
    6210             :                            declaration referred to by this entry; typically,
    6211             :                            it is the same as the type of the variable or
    6212             :                            routine to which this entry corresponds, but it
    6213             :                            needn't be.  It appears on secondary declarations
    6214             :                            for typedefs, but NULL for secondary declarations
    6215             :                            of class, struct, union, and enum types. */
    6216             :   a_name_reference_ptr
    6217             :                 name_reference;
    6218             :                         /* The form of the declarator used in the declaration
    6219             :                            referred to by this entry. */
    6220             :   an_attribute_ptr
    6221             :                 attributes;     
    6222             :                         /* The attributes list specified on this declaration.
    6223             :                            (Each attribute appertaining to a secondary
    6224             :                            declaration is recorded twice: Once here and once
    6225             :                            in the source correspondence entry for the declared
    6226             :                            entity.  I.e., the entries here are copies of those
    6227             :                            recorded in "entity" for this declaration.) */
    6228             :   a_storage_class
    6229             :                 declared_storage_class;
    6230             :                         /* The storage class that explicitly appears in the
    6231             :                            source for this declaration; sc_unspecified if the
    6232             :                            declaration has no explicit storage class. */
    6233             :   a_bit_field   autonomous_tag_decl:1;
    6234             :                         /* If entity refers to a type entry representing a
    6235             :                            class, struct, union, or enum, this flag is TRUE if
    6236             :                            the declaration it corresponds to is not part
    6237             :                            of the declaration of another entity -- i.e., the
    6238             :                            case of a vacuous declaration:
    6239             :                              class A;             // autonomous 2ndary decl
    6240             :                              class A { int i; };  // autonomous primary decl
    6241             :                              class B { int i; };  // autonomous primary decl
    6242             :                              class B;             // autonomous 2ndary decl
    6243             :                            The source sequence entries for the first and
    6244             :                            fourth of these class declarations will have the
    6245             :                            flag set. */
    6246             :   a_bit_field   embedded_source_sequence_entries:1;
    6247             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration represented by this entry
    6248             :                            embeds another construct with associated source
    6249             :                            sequence entries.  For example:
    6250             :                              extern int x[sizeof(struct S { int i; })];
    6251             :                            In this example, the source sequence entries for the
    6252             :                            non-autonomous struct S are considered to be
    6253             :                            "embedded".  In such cases, the embedded entries are
    6254             :                            followed by an a_src_seq_end_of_construct for the
    6255             :                            entity associated with this secondary source
    6256             :                            sequence entry. */
    6257             :   a_bit_field   friend_decl:1;
    6258             :                         /* TRUE when the declaration is a friend declaration;
    6259             :                            "entity" will refer to a routine or class.  (In
    6260             :                            some modes, it may refer to other types as well.) */
    6261             :   a_bit_field   implicit_decl:1;
    6262             :                         /* TRUE when this declaration is an implicit function
    6263             :                            declaration. */
    6264             :   a_bit_field   declared_in_func_prototype:1;
    6265             :                         /* TRUE when the scope of this declaration is a
    6266             :                            function prototype scope -- e.g.,
    6267             :                              void f(struct A *);
    6268             :                            when this is the first declaration of A.  Used in
    6269             :                            both C and C++, though the interpretation of such
    6270             :                            declarations differs between the two languages. */
    6271             :   a_bit_field   specialized_with_new_syntax:1;
    6272             :                         /* TRUE if the "template<>" syntax was used to declare
    6273             :                            a specialization. */
    6274             :   a_bit_field   first_declaration:1;
    6275             :                         /* TRUE if the declaration is the initial appearance
    6276             :                            of an entity in the translation unit; defined only
    6277             :                            for entries referring to class or enum types or
    6278             :                            to routines. */
    6279             : #if TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    6280             :   a_bit_field   is_partial_instantiation:1;
    6281             :                         /* TRUE if this entry represents the partial
    6282             :                            instantiation of a template. */
    6283             :   a_bit_field   compiler_generated_forward_decl:1;
    6284             :                         /* TRUE if this entry represents a forward declaration
    6285             :                            generated by the compiler (for possible use in a
    6286             :                            template argument of a specialization inserted to
    6287             :                            represent a template instantiation). */
    6288             :   a_bit_field   originally_nonautonomous_definition:1;
    6289             :                         /* TRUE if this entry was created to represent the
    6290             :                            partial instantiation of a nested class definition
    6291             :                            that was originally non-autonomous.  The partial
    6292             :                            instantiation must be treated as autonomous, because
    6293             :                            non-autonomous declarations that are not definitions
    6294             :                            are injected in the surrounding namespace scope.
    6295             :                            E.g.:
    6296             :                              template<class T> struct S { struct N {} *p; };
    6297             :                              S<int> s;
    6298             :                            The source sequence entries for S<int> correspond
    6299             :                            to a specialization
    6300             :                              template<> struct S<int> { struct N; N *p; };
    6301             :                            and not
    6302             :                              template<> struct S<int> { struct N *p; };
    6303             :                            since N would be ::N instead of S<int>::N with the
    6304             :                            latter.  This flag is set for N in this case so
    6305             :                            that a later full instantiation can identify where
    6306             :                            the source sequence entries for the S<int>::N
    6307             :                            definition should be inserted. */
    6308             : #endif /* TEMPLATE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    6309             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6310             :   a_bit_field   marked_as_gnu_extension:1;
    6311             :                         /* TRUE if the corresponding declaration was preceded
    6312             :                            by the GNU keyword __extension__. */
    6313             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6314             :   a_bit_field   is_decl_after_first_in_comma_list:1;
    6315             :                         /* This declaration appeared in a comma-separated
    6316             :                            declarator list and was not the first in that list.
    6317             :                            E.g., "j" in "extern int i, j;".  */
    6318             :   a_bit_field   explicit_storage_class:1;
    6319             :                         /* This declaration included an explicit storage class.
    6320             :                            Used by the C++-generating back end to avoid
    6321             :                            rendering "int f(), n;" as "extern int f(), n;"
    6322             :                            (or vice versa). */
    6323             :   a_bit_field   is_alias:1;
    6324             :                         /* TRUE if this declaration is for a typedef declared
    6325             :                            using the alias syntax; e.g., "using T = int;". */
    6326             :   bitfield_to_avoid_codecenter_warnings()
    6327             : #endif
    6328             :

    6444             :         {
    6445             :           case enk_error: s = "enk_error"; break;
    6446             :           case enk_operation: s = "enk_operation"; break;
    6447             :           case enk_constant: s = "enk_constant"; break;
    6448             :           case enk_variable: s = "enk_variable"; break;
    6449             :           case enk_field: s = "enk_field"; break;
    6450             :           case enk_temp_init: s = "enk_temp_init"; break;
    6451             :           case enk_new_delete: s = "enk_new_delete"; break;
    6452             :           case enk_throw: s = "enk_throw"; break;
    6453             :           case enk_condition: s = "enk_condition"; break;
    6454             :           case enk_object_lifetime: s = "enk_object_lifetime"; break;
    6455             :           case enk_typeid: s = "enk_typeid"; break;
    6456             :           case enk_runtime_sizeof: s = "enk_runtime_sizeof"; break;
    6457             :           case enk_address_of_ellipsis: s = "enk_address_of_ellipsis"; break;
    6458             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6459             :           case enk_statement:   /* GNU statement expression, ({...}). */
    6460             :                s = "enk_statement"; break;
    6461             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6462             : 
    6463             : #if (VERSION_NUMBER_FOR_MACRO >= 310)

    6488             : #if 1
    6489           0 : char* summarize_expr_kind (an_expr_node_kind x)
    6490             :    {
    6491             : #if 0
    6492             :   enk_error,            /* Error. */
    6493             :   enk_operation,        /* An operator and n operands; see
    6494             :                            an_expr_operator_kind. */
    6495             :   enk_constant,         /* A constant value. */
    6496             :   enk_variable,         /* A variable. */
    6497             :   enk_field,            /* Used in an eok_dot_field, eok_points_to_field, etc.
    6498             :                            operation to indicate the field. */
    6499             :   enk_temp_init,        /* Initialization of a temporary within an
    6500             :                            expression.  C++ only.  Used in C for C99
    6501             :                            compound literals. */
    6502             :   enk_new_delete,       /* C++ "new" or "delete". */
    6503             :   enk_lambda,           /* C++ lambda expression. */
    6504             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6505             :   enk_gcnew,            /* C++/CLI "gcnew". */
    6506             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6507             :   enk_throw,            /* C++ throw expression. */
    6508             :   enk_condition,        /* C++ condition -- a variable declaration with
    6509             :                            initializer that appears as the condition of an
    6510             :                            if-, switch-, while- or for-statement.  Appears
    6511             :                            only at the top of an expression. */
    6512             :   enk_object_lifetime,  /* Used to introduce an object lifetime that surrounds
    6513             :                            a single expression, to restrict the lifetime
    6514             :                            of temporaries created in the expression.  The
    6515             :                            front end proper always puts these only at the top
    6516             :                            of expressions, but IL lowering sometimes inserts
    6517             :                            code above those nodes, so after IL lowering this
    6518             :                            node is not necessarily the top node in the
    6519             :                            expression tree.  C++ only. */
    6520             :   enk_typeid,           /* C++ typeid expression. */
    6521             :   enk_sizeof,
    6522             :   enk_runtime_sizeof = enk_sizeof,  /* Old name. */
    6523             :                         /* A sizeof expression.  Usually those are folded to
    6524             :                            constants at compile time, but this operator
    6525             :                            still appears in backing expressions, for sizeofs
    6526             :                            applied to dependent types or expressions in
    6527             :                            prototype instantiations, and for sizeofs that
    6528             :                            are actually variable (e.g., sizeof a
    6529             :                            variable-length array). */
    6530             :   enk_sizeof_pack,      /* sizeof...(T), the size of a variadic template
    6531             :                            parameter pack. */
    6532             :   enk_alignof,          /* An alignof expression.  Similar to sizeof, but
    6533             :                            returns the alignment of a type or expression.
    6534             :                            Like enk_sizeof, appears in backing expressions
    6535             :                            and applied to dependent types or expressions in
    6536             :                            prototype instantiations. */
    6537             :   enk_address_of_ellipsis,
    6538             :                         /* Used to represent nonstandard construct "&..."
    6539             :                            (when ALLOW_ADDRESS_OF_ELLIPSIS is TRUE, to support
    6540             :                            stdarg.h macro va_start). */
    6541             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6542             :   enk_statement,        /* GNU statement expression, ({...}). */
    6543             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6544             :   enk_reuse_value,      /* Reuse a value computed elsewhere in the current
    6545             :                            expression tree.  Used for cases where a single
    6546             :                            expression is used twice but evaluated only once
    6547             :                            (all of them extensions in GNU or Microsoft mode).
    6548             :                            Eliminated by IL lowering. */
    6549             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING && !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
    6550             :   enk_lowered_eh_construct,
    6551             :                         /* Used to represent a partially-lowered exception
    6552             :                            handling construct. */
    6553             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING && !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
    6554             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING && ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    6555             :   enk_result_of_overriding_function,
    6556             :                         /* Used in the body of a routine that is an entry
    6557             :                            to be called in a covariant return type situation,
    6558             :                            to represent the result of the call of the
    6559             :                            overriding virtual function.  That result is cast
    6560             :                            to the proper return type for the overridden
    6561             :                            function, to give the value to be returned by
    6562             :                            the entry. */
    6563             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING && ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    6564             :   enk_routine,          /* A routine (function). */
    6565             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL
    6566             :   enk_vla_dealloc,      /* Used to indicate when a variable-length array
    6567             :                            should be deallocated (in C++, this may require
    6568             :                            running destructors). */
    6569             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
    6570             :   enk_type_operand,     /* Used to represent types in certain expression
    6571             :                            constructs. */
    6572             :   enk_builtin_operation,
    6573             :                         /* Used to represent a variety of builtin
    6574             :                            operations. */
    6575             :   enk_param_ref,
    6576             :                         /* Used to represent a reference to a parameter in
    6577             :                            an expression that participates in the signature
    6578             :                            of a function type.  For example, in the function
    6579             :                            declaration "auto f(X a)->decltype(*a)" the use
    6580             :                            of "a" in the decltype construct is represented
    6581             :                            with an enk_param_ref node. */
    6582             :   enk_braced_init_list, /* A C++11 brace-enclosed initializer list. */
    6583             :   enk_c11_generic,      /* Used to represent a C11 _Generic expression
    6584             :                            selection. */
    6585             :   enk_last              /*lint -esym(769,an_expr_node_kind_tag::enk_last)*/
    6586             : #endif
    6587             : 
    6588             : #if 0
    6589             : // EDG 6.0 enum values.
    6590             :   enk_error,            /* Error. */
    6591             :   enk_operation,        /* An operator and n operands; see an_expr_operator_kind. */
    6592             :   enk_constant,         /* A constant value. */
    6593             :   enk_variable,         /* A variable. */
    6594             :   enk_field,            /* Used in an eok_dot_field, eok_points_to_field, etc. operation to indicate the field. */
    6595             :   enk_temp_init,        /* Initialization of a temporary within an expression. Mostly for C++ but used in C for C99 compound literals. */
    6596             :   enk_lambda,           /* C++ lambda expression (very similar to enk_temp_init). */
    6597             :   enk_new_delete,       /* C++ "new" or "delete". */
    6598             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6599             :   enk_gcnew,            /* C++/CLI "gcnew". */
    6600             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6601             :   enk_throw,            /* C++ throw expression. */
    6602             :   enk_condition,        /* C++ condition -- a variable declaration with initializer that appears as the condition of an
    6603             :                            if-, switch-, while- or for-statement.  Appears only at the top of an expression. */
    6604             :   enk_object_lifetime,  /* Used to introduce an object lifetime that surrounds a single expression, to restrict the lifetime
    6605             :                            of temporaries created in the expression.  The front end proper always puts these only at the top
    6606             :                            of expressions, but IL lowering sometimes inserts code above those nodes, so after IL lowering this
    6607             :                            node is not necessarily the top node in the expression tree.  C++ only. */
    6608             :   enk_typeid,           /* C++ typeid expression.  When constexpr is enabled, the non-polymorphic, non-dependent case is
    6609             :                            represented by a ck_address/abk_typeid entry instead. */
    6610             :   enk_sizeof,
    6611             :   enk_runtime_sizeof = enk_sizeof,  /* Old name. */
    6612             :                         /* A sizeof expression.  Usually those are folded to constants at compile time, but this operator
    6613             :                            still appears in backing expressions, for sizeofs applied to dependent types or expressions in
    6614             :                            prototype instantiations, and for sizeofs that are actually variable (e.g., sizeof a
    6615             :                            variable-length array). */
    6616             :   enk_sizeof_pack,      /* sizeof...(T), the size of a variadic template parameter pack. */
    6617             :   enk_alignof,          /* An alignof expression.  Similar to sizeof, but returns the alignment of a type or expression.
    6618             :                            Like enk_sizeof, appears in backing expressions and applied to dependent types or expressions in
    6619             :                            prototype instantiations. */
    6620             :   enk_address_of_ellipsis,
    6621             :                         /* Used to represent nonstandard construct "&..." (when ALLOW_ADDRESS_OF_ELLIPSIS is TRUE, to support stdarg.h macro va_start). */
    6622             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6623             :   enk_statement,        /* GNU statement expression, ({...}). */
    6624             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6625             :   enk_reuse_value,      /* Reuse a value computed elsewhere in the current expression tree.  Used for cases where a single
    6626             :                            expression is used twice but evaluated only once. In standard C++, this is only used for certain
    6627             :                            calls to a std::initializer_list constructor (and that is the only case handled by the constexpr
    6628             :                            interpreter).  All other uses are for extensions such as GCC's two-operand "?:" operator.
    6629             :                            Eliminated by IL lowering. */
    6630             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING && !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING
    6631             :   enk_lowered_eh_construct,
    6632             :                         /* Used to represent a partially-lowered exception handling construct. */
    6633             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING && !DO_FULL_PORTABLE_EH_LOWERING */
    6634             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING && ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN
    6635             :   enk_result_of_overriding_function,
    6636             :                         /* Used in the body of a routine that is an entry to be called in a covariant return type situation,
    6637             :                            to represent the result of the call of the overriding virtual function.  That result is cast
    6638             :                            to the proper return type for the overridden function, to give the value to be returned by the entry. */
    6639             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING && ABI_CHANGES_FOR_COVARIANT_VIRTUAL_FUNC_RETURN */
    6640             :   enk_routine,          /* A routine (function). */
    6641             : #if VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL
    6642             :   enk_vla_dealloc,      /* Used to indicate when a variable-length array should be deallocated (in C++, this may require running destructors). */
    6643             : #endif /* VLA_DEALLOCATIONS_IN_IL */
    6644             :   enk_type_operand,     /* Used to represent types in certain expressionconstructs.  Also used to represent the "default:" case in a C11 _Generic construct. */
    6645             :   enk_builtin_operation,
    6646             :                         /* Used to represent a variety of builtin operations. */
    6647             :   enk_param_ref,
    6648             :                         /* Used to represent a reference to a parameter in an expression that participates in the signature
    6649             :                            of a function type.  For example, in the function declaration "auto f(X a)->decltype(*a)" the use
    6650             :                            of "a" in the decltype construct is represented with an enk_param_ref node. */
    6651             :   enk_braced_init_list, /* A C++11 brace-enclosed initializer list. */
    6652             :   enk_c11_generic,      /* Used to represent a C11 _Generic expression selection. */
    6653             : #if BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED
    6654             :   enk_builtin_choose_expr,
    6655             :                         /* Used to represent the GNU __builtin_choose_expr construct. */
    6656             : #endif /* BUILTIN_FUNCTIONS_ENABLED */
    6657             :   enk_yield,            /* A "co_yield" expression. */
    6658             :   enk_await,            /* A "co_await" expression. */
    6659             :   enk_fold,             /* The generic representation of a C++17 fold expression.  (Concrete instantiations are
    6660             :                            represented using a chain of enk_operation nodes.) */
    6661             :   enk_initializer,      /* When a dynamic_initializer is folded to a constant, this represents the original initializer in the backing expression. */
    6662             :   enk_last
    6663             : #endif

    7714             : #if 0
    7715             : enum a_local_expr_node_ref_kind_tag {
    7716             :   lerk_none,            /* Used for initialization only. */
    7717             :   lerk_typeof,          /* An expression used as an argument for a typeof
    7718             :                            construct. */
    7719             : #if PROTOTYPE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_IL
    7720             :   lerk_generic_sizeof,  /* A template-dependent expression used as an argument
    7721             :                            for a sizeof, alignof, or uuidof construct. */
    7722             : #endif /* PROTOTYPE_INSTANTIATIONS_IN_IL */
    7723             :   lerk_array_bound,     /* The expression for an array bound, which, despite
    7724             :                            being constant, refers to a local variable.  This
    7725             :                            can occur for initialized const variables and for
    7726             :                            non-const variables that appear in unselected
    7727             :                            branches of folded constant expressions. */
    7728             :   lerk_dep_array_bound, /* Like lerk_array_bound, but for the expressions
    7729             :                            under a dependent constant giving the bound, rather
    7730             :                            than the "expr" field of the constant. */
    7731             :   lerk_decltype
    7732             :                         /* An expression used as an argument for a decltype
    7733             :                            construct. */
    7734             : };
    7735             : #endif

    7799             :                            tree of the macro invocation record for the macro
    7800             :                            expansion in which this macro invocation occurred.
    7801             :                            If equal to NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION, this macro
    7802             :                            invocation occurred directly in program text.
    7803             :                            All other negative values indicate that this
    7804             :                            macro invocation record does not denote an actual
    7805             :                            macro invocation but is simply a placeholder
    7806             :                            specifying the number of levels of nesting that
    7807             :                            are to be popped in the transition to the next
    7808             :                            record.  (A single-level pop is implicit.) */
    7809             :   a_macro_ptr   assoc_macro;

    7811             :                            represents.  Will be NULL for negative values of

    7813             :                            NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION. */

    7817             :                            the expansion of another, this position will be in

    7820             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    7821             :   a_simple_source_position
    7822             :                 end;    /* The original location of the last character of the
    7823             :                            macro invocation -- i.e., the last character of the
    7824             :                            name for an object-like macro or the position of
    7825             :                            the closing parenthesis for a function-like
    7826             :                            macro. */
    7827             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    7828             : } a_macro_invocation_record;

    8081           0 : void summarize_decl_pos_info ( const a_decl_position_supplement_ptr & ptr )
    8082             :    {
    8083             :   // DQ (6/13/2013): Added support to output the source position information.
    8084             : #if 0
    8085             :   a_source_range
    8086             :                 identifier_range;
    8087             :                         /* If the associated IL entry has an explicitly
    8088             :                            declared name, the source positions corresponding
    8089             :                            to the start and end of the sequence of tokens that
    8090             :                            represent the identifier, as explicitly spelled in
    8091             :                            the source program (e.g., possibly including
    8092             :                            qualifiers and a template argument list, if they
    8093             :                            were specified explicitly).  May be
    8094             :                            null_source_range. */
    8095             :   a_source_range
    8096             :                 specifiers_range;
    8097             :                         /* If the declaration of the associated IL entry
    8098             :                            involves declaration-specifiers, the source
    8099             :                            positions corresponding to the start and end of the
    8100             :                            declaration-specifiers of the declaration.  (When
    8101             :                            the associated entity is an class or enum type,
    8102             :                            this field corresponds to enum-specifier and
    8103             :                            class-specifier in the grammar.)  May be
    8104             :                            null_source_range. */
    8105             :   union {
    8106             :     a_source_range
    8107             :                 declarator_range;
    8108             :                         /* If the declaration of the associated IL entry
    8109             :                            involves a declarator, the source positions
    8110             :                            corresponding to the start and end of the
    8111             :                            declarator.  May be null_source_range. */
    8112             :     a_source_range
    8113             :                 enum_value_range;
    8114             :                         /* When the associated IL entry is an enumerator, the
    8115             :                            source positions corresponding to the start and
    8116             :                            end positions of the value expression.  May be
    8117             :                            null_source_range (when there is no explicitly
    8118             :                            specified value). */
    8119             :     a_source_range
    8120             :                 namespace_definition_range;

    8122             :                            source positions of the opening and closing
    8123             :                            braces (or the "=" token and the terminating
    8124             :                            semicolon if the entry represents a namespace
    8125             :                            alias). */
    8126             :   } variant;
    8127             :   an_element_position_ptr extra_positions;   /* A list of additional positions recorded for a declaration. */
    8128             : #endif
    8129             :

    8529           0 : getLocationName ( SgScopeStatement* scope )
    8530             :    {
    8531             :   // DQ (11/15/2004): this function builds a string to report the location of the scope 
    8532             :   // used in debugging within the handling of the scope stack.  Might be more useful
    8533             :   // than just for this purpose.
    8534             :

    8542           0 :                SgNamespaceDefinitionStatement *nameSpace = isSgNamespaceDefinitionStatement(scope);
    8543           0 :                ROSE_ASSERT(nameSpace != NULL);

    8546           0 :                break;

    8548             :

    8557           0 :                break;

    8559             :

    9012             : 
    9013             : void
    9014           0 : summarize_expr ( an_expr_node_ptr ptr )
    9015             :    {
    9016             :   // Description of an EDG an_expr_node_ptr
    9017             : #if 0
    9018             : // EDG 4.9 description
    9019             : typedef struct an_expr_node {
    9020             :   a_type_ptr    type;
    9021             :   a_type_ptr    orig_lvalue_type;
    9022             :   an_expr_node_ptr next;
    9023             :   an_expr_node_kind kind;
    9024             :   a_bit_field   is_lvalue:1;
    9025             :   a_bit_field   is_xvalue:1;
    9026             :   a_bit_field   result_is_not_used:1;
    9027             :   a_bit_field   is_initialization_guard:1;
    9028             :   a_bit_field   generated_default_arg:1;
    9029             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    9030             :   a_bit_field   marked_as_gnu_extension:1;
    9031             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    9032             :   a_bit_field   is_static_cast:1;
    9033             : x  a_bit_field  is_functional_notation_cast:1;
    9034             : x  a_bit_field  is_brace_notation_cast:1;
    9035             :   a_bit_field   is_objectless_nonstatic_data_mem_ref:1;

   10284             :    {
   10285             : #if 0
   10286             : typedef struct a_switch_case_entry *a_switch_case_entry_ptr;
   10287             : typedef struct a_switch_case_entry {
   10288             :   /* Description of one "case" of a switch statement.  This could be a
   10289             :     "default:" case, a "case <value>:" case, or a GNU "case <start> ... <end>:"
   10290             :     case. */
   10291             :   a_statement_ptr
   10292             :                 stmt;   /* The stmk_switch_case statement pointing to this
   10293             :                            entry. */
   10294             :   a_constant_ptr
   10295             :                 case_value;
   10296             :                         /* The integer value associated with this case.  (Or
   10297             :                            the value of the start of the range if this is a
   10298             :                            GNU case range.)  NULL for a "default:" case. */
   10299             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   10300             :   a_constant_ptr
   10301             :                 range_end;
   10302             :                         /* If this is a GNU case range, the value of the end
   10303             :                            of the range; otherwise, NULL. */
   10304             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   10305             :   a_switch_case_entry_ptr
   10306             :                 next;
   10307             :                         /* Pointer to the next switch case in source order,
   10308             :                            or NULL if this is the last case. */
   10309             :   a_switch_case_entry_ptr
   10310             :                 next_on_sorted_list;
   10311             :                         /* Pointer to the next switch case in numeric order,
   10312             :                            or NULL if this is the last case.  Also NULL if
   10313             :                            some of the cases are template dependent. */
   10314             :   a_source_position
   10315             :                 position;
   10316             :                         /* The position of the case value.  For a default
   10317             :                            case, the position of the "default" keyword is
   10318             :                            recorded. */
   10319             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   10320             :   a_source_position
   10321             :                 end_position;
   10322             :                         /* The position of the end of the case value.  If this
   10323             :                            entry represents a GNU case range, then this is the
   10324             :                            end position of the range_end value.  For the
   10325             :                            default case, this is the null position. */
   10326             :   a_source_position
   10327             :                 colon_position;
   10328             :                         /* The position of the colon token. */
   10329             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   10330             :   a_bit_field   reachable_by_fall_through:1;
   10331             :                         /* TRUE if this switch case can be reached by falling
   10332             :                            through to it from the code immediately
   10333             :                            preceding. */
   10334             :   bitfield_to_avoid_codecenter_warnings()
   10335             : } a_switch_case_entry;
   10336             : 
   10337             : #endif
   10338             :

   10656           0 : void summarize_namespace ( a_namespace_ptr ptr )
   10657             :    {

   10659             :

   10877             : char*
   10878           0 : summarize_operand_kind ( an_operand_kind kind )

   10882             :         {

   10887           0 :                s = (char*)"ok_expression";
   10888           0 :                break;

   10890           0 :                s = (char*)"ok_constant";
   10891           0 :                break;
   10892           0 :           case ok_indefinite_function:
   10893           0 :                s = (char*)"ok_indefinite_function";
   10894           0 :                break;
   10895           0 :           case ok_sym_for_member:
   10896           0 :                s = (char*)"ok_sym_for_member";
   10897           0 :                break;

   10900             :                s = (char*)"ok_property_ref";
   10901             :                break;
   10902             : #endif
   10903           0 :           case ok_undefined_symbol:
   10904           0 :                s = (char*)"ok_undefined_symbol";
   10905           0 :                break;
   10906             : 
   10907           0 :           default:
   10908           0 :                s = (char*)"**BAD OPERAND KIND**";
   10909             :         }  /* switch */
   10910             : 
   10911           0 :      assert(s != NULL);

   10914             : 
   10915             : #if 0
   10916             : /* Kinds of operands: */
   10917             : enum an_operand_kind_tag {
   10918             :   ok_error,             /* Error. */
   10919             :   ok_expression,        /* An expression tree. */
   10920             :   ok_constant,          /* A constant value. */
   10921             :   ok_indefinite_function,
   10922             :                         /* A function name that's not fully discriminated yet,
   10923             :                            i.e., a C++ overloaded function.  With state ==
   10924             :                            os_function_designator, represents the function
   10925             :                            itself and has very limited lifetime.  With state ==
   10926             :                            os_rvalue, represents the address of an overloaded
   10927             :                            function, and survives until it meets a destination
   10928             :                            type (which selects a specific function) or until
   10929             :                            used in some other way (which is an error).  Not
   10930             :                            used in C. */
   10931             :   ok_sym_for_member,    /* A symbol for a nonstatic data member or nonstatic
   10932             :                            member function.  Represented in this way because
   10933             :                            it's not clear yet how the member is being used --
   10934             :                            its address might be taken (e.g., "&A::f"), it
   10935             :                            might get bound to an object and called (e.g.,
   10936             :                            "p->f(1)"), etc.  Not used for overloaded
   10937             :                            functions (ok_indefinite_function is used
   10938             :                            instead).  Used only in C++. */
   10939             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   10940             :   ok_property_ref,      /* A reference to a field declared with the Microsoft
   10941             :                            C++ extension __declspec(property(...)). */
   10942             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   10943             :   ok_undefined_symbol   /* An undefined symbol encountered while scanning an
   10944             :                            expression.  Could be an implicit function
   10945             :                            declaration or a genuine undefined symbol.
   10946             :                            Has a very limited lifetime. */
   10947             : };
   10948             : 
   10949             : #endif
   10950             :
