   11013             : 
   11014             : #if 0
   11015             : typedef struct an_operand {
   11016             :   a_type_ptr    type;
   11017             :                         /* Type of this operand.  A tk_unknown type if not
   11018             :                            applicable (ok_indefinite_function,
   11019             :                            ok_undefined_symbol). */
   11020             :   an_operand_kind
   11021             :                 kind;
   11022             :                         /* The kind of operand. */
   11023             :   an_operand_state
   11024             :                 state;
   11025             :                         /* Whether the operand is an lvalue, rvalue, or a
   11026             :                            function designator. */
   11027             :   a_bit_field   bound_function:1;
   11028             :                         /* TRUE if the operand is a bound function, i.e.,
   11029             :                            another operand is required to give the object
   11030             :                            relative to which this function is selected. */
   11031             :   a_bit_field   virtual_function:1;
   11032             :                         /* TRUE if the operand represents a virtual
   11033             :                            function. */
   11034             :   a_bit_field   is_qualified_name:1;
   11035             :                         /* TRUE if the operand was generated from a qualified
   11036             :                            name. */
   11037             :   a_bit_field   access_control_error_reported:1;
   11038             :                         /* TRUE if an access control error was reported
   11039             :                            on the base identifier for this operand.  This
   11040             :                            remains meaningful only for operands that are
   11041             :                            essentially still just a representation for
   11042             :                            an identifier, e.g., ok_indefinite_function and
   11043             :                            ok_sym_for_member. */
   11044             :   a_bit_field   is_operand_of_address_of:1;
   11045             :                         /* TRUE if this operand is the immediate operand
   11046             :                            of an "&" address-of operator.  This is
   11047             :                            significant in that it discriminates between
   11048             :                            the standard and nonstandard ways of taking
   11049             :                            a pointer-to-member address of a member function. */
   11050             :   a_bit_field   is_template_id:1;
   11051             :                         /* TRUE if an explicit template argument list
   11052             :                            applies to variant.symbol.  template_arg_list
   11053             :                            gives the argument list. */
   11054             :   a_bit_field   is_simple_string_literal:1;
   11055             :                         /* TRUE if this operand is a simple string literal
   11056             :                            or wide string literal, or the result of the
   11057             :                            decay of such a literal to a pointer.  FALSE
   11058             :                            for a string literal that has been subjected to
   11059             :                            a cast or other operation. */
   11060             :   a_bit_field   is_cfront_null_pointer_constant:1;
   11061             :                         /* TRUE if this operand is a simple 0 which is
   11062             :                            suitable as a null pointer constant in
   11063             :                            overload resolution in cfront mode. */
   11064             :   a_bit_field   is_using_decl_name:1;
   11065             :                         /* TRUE if the operand was generated from a name
   11066             :                            that was declared in a using-declaration. */
   11067             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   11068             :   a_bit_field   is_microsoft_noop:1;
   11069             :                         /* TRUE if the operand came from a Microsoft __noop.
   11070             :                            This is used to suppress the warning that the
   11071             :                            code has no effect. */
   11072             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   11073             : #if RECORD_FORM_OF_NAME_REFERENCE
   11074             :   a_bit_field   name_reference_set:1;
   11075             :                         /* TRUE if name_reference has been set. */
   11076             :   a_name_reference
   11077             :                 name_reference;
   11078             :                         /* Records the form of reference to a name, for
   11079             :                            some operands that represent named entities
   11080             :                            (e.g., a function name).  Valid when
   11081             :                            name_reference_set is TRUE. */
   11082             : #endif /* RECORD_FORM_OF_NAME_REFERENCE */
   11083             :   a_source_position
   11084             :                 position;
   11085             :                         /* The source position for the operand. */
   11086             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   11087             :   a_source_position
   11088             :                 end_position;
   11089             :                         /* The source position of the end of the operand. */
   11090             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   11091             :   a_ref_entry_ptr
   11092             :                 ref_entries_list;
   11093             :                         /* A list of reference entries that are related
   11094             :                            to the operand.  This list includes only entries
   11095             :                            for functions and for entities involved in lvalue
   11096             :                            address computations, whose reference kinds might
   11097             :                            be changed once the full context surrounding the
   11098             :                            operand is known. */
   11099             :   a_template_arg_ptr
   11100             :                 template_arg_list;
   11101             :                         /* When is_template_id is TRUE, a template argument
   11102             :                            list to be applied to variant.symbol. */
   11103             :   a_source_position
   11104             :                 id_position;
   11105             :                         /* Extra source position for an identifier, used
   11106             :                            for ok_indefinite_function and ok_undefined_symbol.
   11107             :                            If the name is "X::f", this gives the position of
   11108             :                            "f", where the field position above gives the
   11109             :                            position of the "X". */
   11110             :   disc_union {
   11111             :     /* When kind == ok_error, no variant fields. */
   11112             :     /* When kind == ok_expression: */
   11113             :     an_expr_node_ptr
   11114             :                 expression;
   11115             :     /* When kind == ok_constant: */
   11116             :     a_constant  constant;
   11117             :     /* When kind == ok_indefinite_function, ok_sym_for_member, or
   11118             :        ok_undefined_symbol: */
   11119             :     a_symbol_ptr
   11120             :                 symbol;
   11121             :                         /* Pointer to the symbol.  May be a projection
   11122             :                            symbol for ok_indefinite_function or
   11123             :                            ok_sym_for_member. */
   11124             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   11125             :     /* When kind == ok_property_ref: */
   11126             :     /* This is used for a reference to a field declared with the Microsoft
   11127             :        C++ extension __declspec(property(...)). */
   11128             :     struct {
   11129             :       an_expr_node_ptr

   11136             :                            like p->x[y][z]. */

   11138             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   11139             :   } variant;
   11140             : } an_operand;

   11143             : #if 0
   11144             : 
   11145             : typedef struct a_using_decl {
   11146             :   a_using_decl_ptr
   11147             :                 next;
   11148             :                         /* Next in a linked list of using-decl entries for the
   11149             :                            current scope; NULL for the last on the list. */
   11150             :   a_source_position
   11151             :                 position;
   11152             :                         /* Source position of the start of the
   11153             :                            using-declaration or using-directive. */
   11154             :   a_tagged_pointer
   11155             :                 entity;
   11156             :                         /* Entry identifying the entity specified in the
   11157             :                            using-declaration or using-directive; when a
   11158             :                            using-declaration specifies an overload set, each
   11159             :                            function or function template is recorded
   11160             :                            individually. */
   11161             :   an_attribute_ptr
   11162             :                 attributes;
   11163             :                         /* A list of attributes (NULL if none) specified on
   11164             :                            this using-declaration or using-directive. */
   11165             :   a_bit_field   is_using_directive:1;
   11166             :                         /* TRUE if this is a using-directive and FALSE if it
   11167             :                            is a using-declaration. */
   11168             :   a_bit_field   is_class_member:1;
   11169             :                         /* When is_using_directive is FALSE, this flag is TRUE
   11170             :                            if this using-declaration refers to a class member
   11171             :                            and FALSE if it refers to a non-class member.
   11172             :                            This usually corresponds with whether or not the
   11173             :                            using-declaration appeared as a class member, but
   11174             :                            in Microsoft bugs mode a nonmember using-declaration
   11175             :                            can refer to a type that is a class member. */
   11176             :   a_bit_field   hidden:1;
   11177             :                         /* For class member using-declarations only, TRUE if
   11178             :                            a base class member brought into a derived class
   11179             :                            by a using-declaration is subsequently hidden by a
   11180             :                            declaration in the derived class. */
   11181             :   a_bit_field   compiler_generated:1;
   11182             :                         /* TRUE for a using-directive that did not actually
   11183             :                            appear in the source.  This is the case for the
   11184             :                            implicit using-directive created when using
   11185             :                            unnamed namespaces and is also TRUE for the
   11186             :                            using-directive created to simulate a Microsoft
   11187             :                            bug (in Microsoft bugs mode). */
   11188             :   a_bit_field   strong:1;
   11189             :                         /* TRUE for a GNU strong using-directive.  A strong
   11190             :                            using-directive differs from a normal
   11191             :                            using-directive in the following ways:
   11192             :                            1. Class templates from the used namespace can be
   11193             :                               specialized as if they were members of the
   11194             :                               namespace containing the using-directive.
   11195             :                            2. The namespace containing the using-directive is
   11196             :                               considered an associated namespace for types
   11197             :                               in the used namespace (for argument-dependent
   11198             :                               lookup).
   11199             :                            3. In a qualified lookup, namespaces in strong
   11200             :                               using-directives are examined even if the
   11201             :                               namespace named in the qualified name contains
   11202             :                               the named member. */
   11203             :   an_access_specifier
   11204             :                 access;
   11205             :                         /* For class member using-declarations only, the
   11206             :                            adjusted access for the indicated base class
   11207             :                            member. */
   11208             :   a_parent_class_or_namespace
   11209             :                 qualifier;
   11210             :                         /* For using-declarations only, the class or namespace
   11211             :                            that was actually specified in the qualified name
   11212             :                            that appeared in the source code (which is not
   11213             :                            necessarily the same as the parent of that which is
   11214             :                            referred to by entity.ptr).  For class member
   11215             :                            using-declarations, use the class_type variant;
   11216             :                            otherwise, use the namespace_ptr variant, which
   11217             :                            will be NULL when the global qualifier ("::") was
   11218             :                            specified. */
   11219             :   unsigned long decl_sequence_number;
   11220             :                         /* For using-directives, the declaration sequence
   11221             :                            number of the location of the using-directive.  This
   11222             :                            is for front-end use for lookups with template
   11223             :                            instantiations.  Using-directives that appear
   11224             :                            after the definition of the template are
   11225             :                            ignored.  This field is set only for namespace
   11226             :                            scope using-directives.  For block scope
   11227             :                            using-directives, it is set to the special value
   11228             :                            FIRST_DECL_SEQUENCE_NUMBER. */
   11229             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   11230             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr
   11231             :                 source_sequence_entry;
   11232             :                         /* Pointer to the source sequence entry that represents
   11233             :                            the place this using-declaration or using-directive
   11234             :                            appears within the current scope relative to other
   11235             :                            declarations, statements, etc.  It may be NULL
   11236             :                            if the entry refers to a member of an overload set,
   11237             :                            since only one member of set (namely, the head of
   11238             :                            the list linked by the next_in_overload_set pointer)
   11239             :                            actually points to (and is pointed to by) the
   11240             :                            source-sequence entry for the declaration. */
   11241             :   a_using_decl_ptr
   11242             :                 next_in_overload_set;
   11243             :                         /* Pointer to the next in a linked list of using-decl
   11244             :                            entries that represent members of an overload set
   11245             :                            referred to by a single using-declaration.  NULL
   11246             :                            when the entry is not a member of an overload set
   11247             :                            or is the last in the chain. */
   11248             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   11249             : } a_using_decl;
   11250             : 
   11251             : #endif
   11252             : 
   11253             : 
   11254             : void
   11255           0 : summarize_using_declaration ( a_using_decl_ptr ptr )
   11256             :    {
   11257             :   /* Description of an EDG a_using_decl_ptr */
   11258             : 
   11259           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT (ptr != NULL);
   11260             : 
   11261           0 :      printf ("In summarize_using_declaration (%p) \n",ptr);
   11262             : 
   11263           0 :      printf ("     next                    = %p \n",ptr->next);
   11264             :   // printf ("     --- kind                = %s \n",summarize_entry_kind_in_string_kind(ptr->entity.kind));
   11265           0 :      printf ("     --- kind                = %s \n",summarize_entry_kind_in_string_kind(ptr->entity).c_str());
   11266           0 :      printf ("     --- ptr                 = %p \n",ptr->entity.ptr);
   11267             : 
   11268           0 :      printf ("     attributes  - - - - - - = %p \n",ptr->attributes);
   11269           0 :      an_attribute_ptr attribute = ptr->attributes;
   11270           0 :      while (attribute != NULL)
   11271             :         {
   11272           0 :           summarize_attribute(attribute);
   11273           0 :           attribute = attribute->next;
   11274             :         }
   11275             : 
   11276           0 :      printf ("     is_using_directive      = %s \n",ptr->is_using_directive ? "true" : "false");

   11278           0 :      printf ("     hidden                  = %s \n",ptr->hidden ? "true" : "false");
   11279           0 :      printf ("     compiler_generated      = %s \n",ptr->compiler_generated ? "true" : "false");

   11303             : #if 0
   11304             : 
   11305             :   a_scope_ptr
   11306             :                 next;
   11307             :                         /* Pointer to next scope on the same level, which
   11308             :                            must be in the same memory region. */
   11309             :   a_scope_ptr
   11310             :                 parent;
   11311             :                         /* Pointer to the parent scope.  NULL when kind ==
   11312             :                            sck_file.  Also NULL if pointing to the parent
   11313             :                            would cause a memory region problem, i.e., when
   11314             :                            a scope for a function-local entity is in the
   11315             :                            file-scope memory region and its parent is in a
   11316             :                            function-scope memory region.  In that case, an
   11317             :                            entry of type a_local_scope_ref is allocated to
   11318             :                            point to the parent.  Function prototype scopes
   11319             :                            are an exception: parent is NULL for those (with
   11320             :                            no a_local_scope_ref alternative), except when
   11321             :                            nested in another function prototype scope. */
   11322             :   a_scope_number
   11323             :                 number; /* Scope number (unique identifier) for this scope. */
   11324             :   a_scope_kind  kind;
   11325             :                         /* Kind of scope (file, function, block, function
   11326             :                            prototype, etc.). */
   11327             :   a_byte_boolean
   11328             :                 function_body_processing_finished;
   11329             :                         /* Front-end only, for sck_function scopes: set to
   11330             :                            TRUE once the function body processing is
   11331             :                            finished.  That includes IL lowering if
   11332             :                            appropriate.  FALSE otherwise. */
   11333             : #if SCOPE_ORPHANED_LIST_PROCESSING_NEEDED
   11334             :   a_byte_boolean
   11335             :                 scope_orphaned_list_header_generated;
   11336             :                         /* TRUE if a scope orphaned list header entry has
   11337             :                            been generated for this scope.  This is done right
   11338             :                            after IL lowering, if any. */
   11339             : #endif /* SCOPE_ORPHANED_LIST_PROCESSING_NEEDED */
   11340             :   union {
   11341             :     /* When kind == sck_file, no variant fields. */
   11342             :     /* When kind == sck_template_declaration, no variant fields. */
   11343             :     /* When kind == sck_block (also see assoc_block below): */
   11344             :     a_handler_ptr
   11345             :                 assoc_handler;
   11346             :                         /* When the scope is associated with an exception
   11347             :                            handler, a pointer to the handler entry; otherwise
   11348             :                            NULL. */
   11349             :     /* When kind == sck_func_prototype, sck_class_struct_union,
   11350             :        sck_class_reactivation, or sck_enum: */
   11351             :     a_type_ptr  assoc_type;
   11352             :                         /* The function type whose prototype scope this is,
   11353             :                            or the class/struct/union type. */
   11354             :     /* When kind == sck_condition (C++ only): */
   11355             :     a_statement_ptr
   11356             :                 assoc_statement;
   11357             :                         /* Pointer to the associated if, switch, while, or
   11358             :                            for statement in which the condition declaration
   11359             :                            appears. */
   11360             :     /* When kind == sck_namespace (C++ only): */
   11361             :     a_namespace_ptr
   11362             :                 assoc_namespace;
   11363             :                         /* Pointer to the namespace entry associated with this
   11364             :                            scope. */
   11365             :     /* When kind == sck_function: */
   11366             :     struct {
   11367             :       a_routine_ptr
   11368             :                 ptr;
   11369             :                         /* Pointer to the routine associated with this
   11370             :                            scope. */
   11371             :       a_variable_ptr
   11372             :                 parameters;
   11373             :                         /* List of parameters of the associated routine,
   11374             :                            in declaration order.  NULL if no parameters. */
   11375             :       a_constructor_init_ptr
   11376             :                 constructor_inits;
   11377             :                         /* List of constructor initializer entries; non-NULL
   11378             :                            for scopes associated with C++ constructors and
   11379             :                            destructors only.  The list identifies all
   11380             :                            subobjects and nonstatic data members of the
   11381             :                            object being initialized by the constructor,
   11382             :                            or being destroyed by the destructor, arranged
   11383             :                            in the order in which the initialization or
   11384             :                            destruction should be performed (ARM 12.6.2). */
   11385             :       an_object_lifetime_ptr
   11386             :                 lifetime_of_local_static_vars;
   11387             :                         /* If non-NULL, points to an object lifetime for
   11388             :                            the local static variables declared within the
   11389             :                            routine, whether in this scope or a block scope
   11390             :                            contained within it. */
   11391             :       a_variable_ptr
   11392             :                 this_param_variable;
   11393             :                         /* If the scope is for a C++ nonstatic member
   11394             :                            function, this field points to the implicit "this"
   11395             :                            parameter.  It is NULL in all other cases. */
   11396             :       a_variable_ptr
   11397             :                 return_value_variable;
   11398             :                         /* If non-NULL, return value optimization is possible
   11399             :                            in this routine.  That is, the routine returns a
   11400             :                            class value via a copy constructor, and all return
   11401             :                            statements return a single nonstatic local variable,
   11402             :                            namely the variable pointed to by this field.
   11403             :                            Note that the variable is also on the local
   11404             :                            variables list of this scope. */
   11405             :     } routine;
   11406             :   } variant;
   11407             :   a_statement_ptr
   11408             :                 assoc_block;
   11409             :                         /* Non-NULL if this scope has an associated block
   11410             :                            of statements.  NULL if none (including implicitly
   11411             :                            generated sck_block scopes containing for-init
   11412             :                            declarations).  Used only when kind == sck_function
   11413             :                            or sck_block.  The statement pointed to is
   11414             :                            usually an stmk_block statement; however, in C++
   11415             :                            mode when kind == sck_function, it can also be an
   11416             :                            stmk_try_block statement, to indicate a
   11417             :                            function-try-block. */
   11418             : #if ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED
   11419             :                         /* Also used to point to the stmk_asm_func_body
   11420             :                            statement that represents the uninterpreted body
   11421             :                            of an asm function.  Used in this way only when
   11422             :                            kind == sck_function and the associated routine
   11423             :                            has a storage class of sc_asm. */
   11424             : #endif /* ASM_FUNCTION_ALLOWED */
   11425             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr
   11426             :                 lifetime;
   11427             :                         /* Object lifetime that is equivalent to the full
   11428             :                            scope lifetime.  NULL if the scope contains no
   11429             :                            objects that require destruction (and therefore
   11430             :                            always NULL in C mode). */
   11431             :   a_constant_ptr
   11432             :                 constants;
   11433             :                         /* List of named constants of this scope, NULL if
   11434             :                            none. */
   11435             :   a_type_ptr    types;  /* List of local types of this scope, NULL if
   11436             :                            none. */
   11437             :   a_variable_ptr
   11438             :                 variables;
   11439             :                         /* List of local variables of this scope, NULL
   11440             :                            if none.  In a function or block scope, this is the
   11441             :                            list of variables with static allocation; in a scope
   11442             :                            for a class, this is the list of static data
   11443             :                            members.  All variables on this list will be
   11444             :                            allocated in the file scope memory region. */
   11445             :   a_variable_ptr
   11446             :                 nonstatic_variables;
   11447             :                         /* List of local nonstatic variables in a function or
   11448             :                            block scope.  Always NULL at file scope.  Variables
   11449             :                            on this list will be allocated in the function
   11450             :                            scope's memory region. */
   11451             :   a_label_ptr   labels; /* List of local labels of this scope, NULL
   11452             :                            if none.  Only used at the function scope level
   11453             :                            and for locally declared labels in GNU C mode
   11454             :                            (NULL otherwise). */
   11455             :   a_routine_ptr routines;
   11456             :                         /* List of local routines of this scope, NULL
   11457             :                            if none.  Includes both routines with definitions
   11458             :                            and those that are just declarations of interfaces
   11459             :                            to external routines.  In a scope for a class,
   11460             :                            points to a list of the member functions for the
   11461             :                            class (both static and non-static). */
   11462             :   an_asm_entry_ptr
   11463             :                 asm_entries;
   11464             :                         /* List of asm entries representing asm declarations
   11465             :                            that appear in the current scope, NULL if none.
   11466             :                            (Note: asm entries associated with asm statements
   11467             :                            do not show up on this list, and so the pointer is
   11468             :                            always NULL for function and block scopes.  Neither
   11469             :                            are asm functions included in the list.) */
   11470             :   a_scope_ptr   scopes; /* List of local scopes under this scope.  Used for
   11471             :                            block scopes inside function and block scopes,
   11472             :                            and prototype scopes inside prototype scopes.
   11473             :                            NULL if none or not applicable (e.g., at the
   11474             :                            file scope).  Note that block scopes inside
   11475             :                            block scopes will appear on the scopes list
   11476             :                            for those block scopes, not at the function scope
   11477             :                            level.  Condition scopes can also appear. */
   11478             :   a_namespace_ptr
   11479             :                 namespaces;
   11480             :                         /* List of namespaces and namespace-aliases defined
   11481             :                            within the current scope (C++ only).  Will point
   11482             :                            only to namespace-alias entries in sck_function
   11483             :                            and sck_block scopes, to either in sck_file and
   11484             :                            sck_namespace scopes; NULL otherwise. */
   11485             :   a_using_decl_ptr
   11486             :                 using_decls;
   11487             :                         /* List of using-declarations and/or using-directives
   11488             :                            appearing within the current scope (C++ only).  If
   11489             :                            this is an sck_file, sck_namespace, sck_function,
   11490             :                            or sck_block scope, this list may be a mix of
   11491             :                            nonmember using-declarations and using-directives
   11492             :                            (and may be NULL if no such declarations appeared);
   11493             :                            if it is an sck_class_struct_union scope, the list
   11494             :                            will only contain class member using-declarations
   11495             :                            (and will be NULL if there are none and/or if the
   11496             :                            associated class is not a derived class).  Cleared
   11497             :                            to NULL by IL lowering. */
   11498             :   a_dynamic_init_ptr
   11499             :                 dynamic_inits;
   11500             :                         /* List of dynamic initializations to be done in the
   11501             :                            scope, in the order they should be done (C++ only).
   11502             :                            Used only at file scope or namespace scope; in a
   11503             :                            function or block scope, where initializations may
   11504             :                            occur anywhere, stmk_init statements are used to
   11505             :                            indicate the points within the code where each
   11506             :                            initialization should be done. */
   11507             :   a_local_static_variable_init_ptr
   11508             :                 local_static_variable_inits;
   11509             :                         /* List of local static variable initializations in
   11510             :                            function or block scope; NULL at file or namespace
   11511             :                            scope.  Only dynamic and aggregate-constant
   11512             :                            initializations are represented.  The order of
   11513             :                            entries on the list is not meaningful. */
   11514             :   a_vla_dimension_ptr
   11515             :                 vla_dimensions;
   11516             :                         /* List of dimension expressions for VLAs declared
   11517             :                            within a given function -- sck_function scopes;
   11518             :                            The order of entries on the list is not
   11519             :                            significant. */
   11520             :   a_local_expr_node_ref_ptr
   11521             :                 expr_node_refs;
   11522             :                         /* List of references to expressions within this scope
   11523             :                            (only non-NULL for certain function scopes).  The
   11524             :                            order of entries on the list is not significant.
   11525             :                            The entries represent implicit references from the
   11526             :                            file scope memory region. */
   11527             :   a_local_scope_ref_ptr
   11528             :                 scope_refs;
   11529             :                         /* List of references to scopes within this scope
   11530             :                            (only non-NULL for certain function scopes).  The
   11531             :                            order of entries on the list is not significant.
   11532             :                            The entries represent implicit references from the
   11533             :                            file scope memory region. */
   11534             :   a_pragma_ptr  pragmas;
   11535             :                         /* A linked list of pragma entries.  They may be
   11536             :                            bound to specific declarations or statements or
   11537             :                            they may be unbound, meaning they have general
   11538             :                            effect over this scope. */
   11539             :   a_scope_depth depth_in_scope_stack;
   11540             :                         /* Used during front end processing, the depth in
   11541             :                            the scope stack of the entry corresponding to this
   11542             :                            IL scope entry; NO_SCOPE_DEPTH once it has been
   11543             :                            popped off the scope stack.   If the scope is on the
   11544             :                            stack more than once, this contains the depth of
   11545             :                            the first entry pushed (this only occurs for
   11546             :                            namespace and namespace extension scopes).
   11547             :                            Reactivating a class or namespace scope does
   11548             :                            not affect this value. */
   11549             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   11550             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr
   11551             :                 source_sequence_list;
   11552             :                         /* For file and function scopes, a doubly-linked list
   11553             :                            of source sequence entries representing all
   11554             :                            declarations, statements, macros, pragmas, and
   11555             :                            comments that appear within the textual extent of
   11556             :                            the scope. */
   11557             :   a_src_seq_sublist_ptr
   11558             :                 src_seq_sublist_list;
   11559             :                         /* For function scopes, a linked list of source
   11560             :                            sequence sublist headers, representing those
   11561             :                            portions of the function-scope source sequence list
   11562             :                            comprised of entries belonging to the file-scope
   11563             :                            memory region. */
   11564             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   11565             : #if RECORD_HIDDEN_NAMES_IN_IL
   11566             :   a_hidden_name_ptr
   11567             :                 hidden_names;
   11568             :                         /* For file, function, and block scopes, a linked
   11569             :                            list of hidden-name entries, designating entities
   11570             :                            that can be made available in the current scope
   11571             :                            only if an elaborated type specifier and/or global
   11572             :                            qualification (a preceding "::") is used.  Only
   11573             :                            used in C++. */
   11574             : #endif /* RECORD_HIDDEN_NAMES_IN_IL */

   11576             :                 templates;
   11577             :                         /* Linked list of template entries. Only used
   11578             :                            in C++. */

   11580             :   an_ms_attribute_ptr
   11581             :                 ms_attributes;

   11583             :                            entries are present only in namespace scopes

   11598             : 
   11599             : 
   11600             : 
   11601             : #if 0
   11602             : typedef struct a_local_scope_ref {
   11603             :   /* Entities in file-scope memory region cannot directly refer to function-
   11604             :      local entities.  To work around that constraint for function-local
   11605             :      scopes, an implicit referencing mechanism is used.  The implicit
   11606             :      references are represented by a_local_scope_ref entries stored in the
   11607             :      function's memory region: Each entry points to both the referenced
   11608             :      scope and to the entity in file-scope memory that implicitly refers to
   11609             :      that scope.  The list of a_local_scope_ref entries (pointed to from the
   11610             :      a_scope entry of the function in which the referenced entity appears)
   11611             :      can then be searched whenever the reference must be resolved for a
   11612             :      given entity in file-scope memory.  (This technique is similar to that
   11613             :      enabled by a_local_static_variable_init entries.) */
   11614             :   a_local_scope_ref_ptr
   11615             :                 next;
   11616             :                         /* Pointer to the next reference in the current
   11617             :                            function. */
   11618             :   a_scope_ptr
   11619             :                 scope;
   11620             :                         /* Pointer to the referenced scope. */
   11621             :   a_tagged_pointer
   11622             :                 referrer;
   11623             :                         /* The entity (in file scope memory region) implicitly
   11624             :                            referring to scope. */
   11625             : } a_local_scope_ref;
   11626             : #endif
   11627             : 
   11628           0 : void summarize_local_scope_ref ( a_local_scope_ref_ptr input_ptr )

   11644             :              {
   11645           0 :                printf ("     ---- ---- ---- local_scope_ref: referrer.kind (value)  = %d \n",ptr->referrer.kind);

   11977             : #if 0
   11978             : typedef struct a_local_expr_node_ref {
   11979             :   /* Entities in file-scope memory region cannot directly refer to function-
   11980             :      local entities.  To work around that constraint for function-local
   11981             :      expression nodes, an implicit referencing mechanism is used.  The
   11982             :      implicit references are represented by a_local_expr_node_ref entries
   11983             :      stored in the function's memory region: Each entry points to both the
   11984             :      referenced expression and to the entity in file-scope memory that
   11985             :      implicitly refers to that expression.  The list of a_local_expr_node_ref
   11986             :      entries can then be searched whenever the reference must be resolved for
   11987             :      a given entity in file-scope memory.  (This technique is similar to that
   11988             :      enabled by a_local_static_variable_init entries.) */
   11989             :   a_local_expr_node_ref_ptr
   11990             :                 next;
   11991             :                         /* Pointer to the next reference in the current
   11992             :                            (function or block) scope. */
   11993             :   an_expr_node_ptr
   11994             :                 expr;
   11995             :                         /* Pointer to the referenced expression. */
   11996             :   a_local_expr_node_ref_kind
   11997             :                 kind;
   11998             :                         /* Identifies the nature of the construct that
   11999             :                            causes the reference. */
   12000             :   a_tagged_pointer
   12001             :                 referrer;
   12002             :                         /* Tag and generic pointer identifying the entity (in
   12003             :                            file scope memory region) implicitly referring to
   12004             :                            expr. */
   12005             : } a_local_expr_node_ref;
   12006             : #endif
   12007             :

   12403             : char*
   12404           0 : summarize_templ_arg_kind_in_string(a_templ_arg_kind kind)
   12405             :    {
   12406           0 :      char* s = NULL;
   12407             : 
   12408             :   // printf ("In summarize_templ_arg_kind_in_string(kind = %d) \n",kind);
   12409             : 
   12410           0 :      switch (kind)
   12411             :         {
   12412             :           case tak_type:                    s = (char*)"tak_type";                    break;
   12413           0 :           case tak_nontype:                 s = (char*)"tak_nontype";                 break;
   12414           0 :           case tak_template:                s = (char*)"tak_template";                break;
   12415           0 :           case tak_start_of_pack_expansion: s = (char*)"tak_start_of_pack_expansion"; break;
   12416             : 
   12417           0 :           default: s = (char*)"**BAD templ_arg_kind**";
   12418             :         }
   12419             : 
   12420           0 :      assert (s != NULL);
   12421             : 
   12422           0 :      return s;
   12423             :    }
   12424             :

   12431             : #if 0
   12432             : typedef struct a_template_arg {
   12433             :   /* Representation of an actual argument of an instance of a template class
   12434             :      or template function.  A list of these is used to represent the actual
   12435             :      argument list for such an instance. */
   12436             :   a_template_arg_ptr
   12437             :                 next;   /* Next in a linked list of template arguments. */
   12438             :   a_templ_arg_kind
   12439             :                 kind;
   12440             :                         /* Specifies whether this is a type, nontype,
   12441             :                            or template template argument. */
   12442             :   struct a_pack_expansion_descr
   12443             :                 *pack_expansion_descr;
   12444             :                         /* If non-NULL, this argument is a pack expansion,
   12445             :                            and this points to the expansion description. */
   12446             :   a_bit_field   is_array_bound_of_unknown_type:1;
   12447             :                         /* TRUE if the template argument is a deduced array
   12448             :                            bound whose type is not yet known. */
   12449             :   a_bit_field   explicitly_specified:1;
   12450             :                         /* TRUE, for a function template argument list, if the
   12451             :                            argument was explicitly specified.  When a reference
   12452             :                            is being processed, this flag is set only for those
   12453             :                            arguments that were explicitly specified for that
   12454             :                            reference.  For a template argument list associated
   12455             :                            with an instance of the function template, this flag
   12456             :                            is set if any reference to the template explicitly
   12457             :                            specified the argument. */
   12458             :   a_bit_field   template_template_param_checked:1;
   12459             :                         /* TRUE for template template arguments if the template
   12460             :                            parameter list of the argument template has already
   12461             :                            been compared with that of the parameter
   12462             :                            template.  Used only in the front end. */
   12463             :   a_bit_field   is_pack_element:1;

   12477             :     /* When kind == tak_type. */

   12481             :     /* When kind == tak_nontype and is_array_bound_of_unknown_type == FALSE. */

   12483             :                 constant;
   12484             :                         /* The constant supplied as the argument.  Note that
   12485             :                            when arg_operand (below) is non-NULL, this field
   12486             :                            may be NULL.  If both are set, this field points
   12487             :                            to the version that stays in the IL, which has less
   12488             :                            information than the arg_operand form.  Also
   12489             :                            NULL for an unspecified template argument at
   12490             :                            the end of a list that begins with explicit template
   12491             :                            arguments. */
   12492             :     /* When kind == tak_nontype and is_array_bound_of_unknown_type == TRUE. */

   12494             :                 integer_value;
   12495             :                         /* The integer value deduced from an array bound.
   12496             :                            This value is only used during type deduction.
   12497             :                            At the end of type deduction, the type of the
   12498             :                            parameter being deduced is known and this value
   12499             :                            is converted into a normal constant parameter.
   12500             :                            Contains zero if no value has been deduced yet. */
   12501             :     /* When kind == tak_template */
   12502             :     struct {
   12503             :       a_template_ptr
   12504             :                 ptr;
   12505             :                         /* The template supplied as the argument. */

   12507             :                 substituted_param_template;

   12509             :                            is an argument has a template parameter with a

   12511             :                            template parameter.  This comes up in cases like
   12512             :                            "template <class T, template <T t> struct X> ...".

   12514             :                            be used when scanning template argument lists of
   12515             :                            the template template parameter.  Used only in
   12516             :                            the front end. */
   12517             :     } templ;

   12521             :                 arg_operand;

   12523             :                            is scanned, the corresponding parameter type is
   12524             :                            not yet known.  Consequently, the argument cannot
   12525             :                            be converted to its eventual type, nor can a member
   12526             :                            of an overload set be selected.  Instead, the
   12527             :                            argument must be retained in a form that permits
   12528             :                            such operations to be performed later when the
   12529             :                            parameter type (or potential parameter type) is
   12530             :                            known.  The argument is represented by the
   12531             :                            type "an_arg_operand", which is used within the
   12532             :                            expression processing routines.  NULL for cases

   12534             :                            the front end proper.  Used only in the same
   12535             :                            cases as the "constant" field above, i.e., for

   12612             :                            to be rescanned for an expansion of the pack. */
   12613             :   a_token_sequence_number

   12616             :                            to be rescanned for an expansion of the pack. */

   12638             :                            declarator and a parenthesized initializer so that
   12639             :                            during an actual instantiation the zero-trip case

   12641             :   a_byte_boolean

   12644             :                            from enclosing templates.  These must be expanded
   12645             :                            during the declaration of a nested template. */

   12704             :                            scope, NULL if this label is the last in the

   12708             :                            through to it from the code immediately
   12709             :                            preceding. */

   12719             :                            is the target of a "continue" statement. */

   12794             :                            symbolic debug purposes. */
   12795             :   a_scope_ptr   assoc_scope;

   12797             :                            is no associated scope.  This is only used for
   12798             :                            blocks that have local declarations.  Specifically,
   12799             :                            it is not used for the scope associated with a
   12800             :                            function (i.e., the block for the compound 
   12801             :                            statement that is the body of a function has
   12802             :                            assoc_scope == NULL). */
   12803             :   an_object_lifetime_ptr
   12804             :                 lifetime;

   12806             :                            or NULL if there isn't one.  Used only when
   12807             :                            assoc_scope is NULL but nevertheless there is
   12808             :                            an object lifetime region associated with this
   12809             :                            block (e.g., for cfront dependent statements). */
   12810             :   a_bit_field   end_of_block_reachable:1;

   12812             :                            safe setting is TRUE. */
   12813             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   12816             :                            a GNU statement expression. */
   12817             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12818             :   a_bit_field   implicit_scope_not_allowed:1;

   12820             :                            merely to allow grouping some statements together
   12821             :                            and a scope should not be added to it (e.g., to
   12822             :                            contain generated temporaries). */
   12823             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12824             :   a_upc_access_method
   12825             :                 upc_access_method;
   12826             :                         /* Indicates the default access method for shared
   12827             :                            variables within this block (can be modified with
   12828             :                            a UPC pragma). */
   12829             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12830             : } a_block;

   12851             : char*
   12852           0 : summarize_pragma_kind_in_string (a_pragma_kind kind)
   12853             :    {
   12854             : #if 0
   12855             : /* The pragma kinds representing the specific pragmas that are recognized
   12856             :    by the implementation.  Some may refer to pragmas for which entries of
   12857             :    type a_pragma are added to the IL for processing by the back end, but
   12858             :    some may be for front-end processing only. */
   12859             : enum a_pragma_kind_tag {
   12860             :   pk_none,
   12861             :   pk_printf_args,       /* Next function declaration has a printf-style format
   12862             :                            string that should be checked against the arguments
   12863             :                            in the call; front-end only. */
   12864             :   pk_scanf_args,        /* Next function declaration has a scanf-style format
   12865             :                            string that should be checked against the arguments
   12866             :                            in the call; front-end only. */
   12867             :   pk_lint_argsused,     /* Lint "argsused" comment; not strictly a pragma but
   12868             :                            processed similarly; front-end only. */
   12869             :   pk_lint_varargs_count,/* Lint "varargs" comment; not strictly a pragma but
   12870             :                            processed similarly; front-end only. */
   12871             :   pk_lint_notreached,   /* Lint "not reached" comment; not strictly a pragma
   12872             :                            but processed similarly; front-end only. */
   12873             :   pk_instantiate,       /* Instantiation of the specified template entity
   12874             :                            is required; front-end only. */
   12875             :   pk_do_not_instantiate,/* Instantiation of the specified template entity
   12876             :                            should not be done in the current translation
   12877             :                            unit; front-end only. */
   12878             :   pk_can_instantiate,   /* Instantiation of the specified template entity
   12879             :                            may be done in the current translation unit if
   12880             :                            needed; front-end only. */
   12881             :   pk_inline_template,   /* An explicit instantiation directive prefixed by
   12882             :                            the inline keyword.  Used in g++ mode to cause the
   12883             :                            vtable to be emitted.  Used in the front end only.
   12884             :                            There is not actually an inline template pragma.
   12885             :                            This is used because the instantiation_directive
   12886             :                            required a pragma kind to indicate the action to
   12887             :                            be performed. */
   12888             : #if USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING
   12889             :   pk_pack,              /* Establishes maximum alignment of nonstatic data
   12890             :                            members of subsequent classes, structs, and
   12891             :                            unions. */
   12892             : #endif /* USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING */
   12893             : #if IDENT_DIRECTIVE_AND_PRAGMA
   12894             :   pk_ident,             /* Specifies a source identification string (like
   12895             :                            #ident); passed on to the back end. */
   12896             : #endif /* IDENT_DIRECTIVE_AND_PRAGMA */
   12897             : #if PRAGMA_WEAK_ALLOWED
   12898             :   pk_weak,              /* Specifies "weak binding" for C_mode() name.  The
   12899             :                            name is passed on to the back end. */
   12900             : #endif /* PRAGMA_WEAK_ALLOWED */
   12901             :   pk_once,              /* Indicates that a header file should only be
   12902             :                            included once, even if referenced more than once. */
   12903             :   pk_hdrstop,           /* End of sequence of includes to be represented as
   12904             :                            a precompiled header.  Ignored except during
   12905             :                            PCH prefix scanning. */
   12906             :   pk_no_pch,            /* Suppresses generation of PCH file.
   12907             :                            Ignored except during PCH prefix scanning. */
   12908             :   pk_define_type_info,  /* The following class definition provides the
   12909             :                            definition of the type_info type returned
   12910             :                            by typeid. */
   12911             :   pk_stdc,              /* Used for the C99 predefined pragmas (i.e.,
   12912             :                            FP_CONTRACT, FENV_ACCESS, and CX_LIMITED_RANGE).
   12913             :                            Also used for the "Embedded C" (TR 18037) fixed-
   12914             :                            point pragmas. */
   12915             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12916             :   pk_upc,               /* UPC-specific pragma, controlling the default
   12917             :                            access method for shared data. */
   12918             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12919             : #if REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED
   12920             :   pk_redefine_extname,  /* Solaris-specific pragma that allows external
   12921             :                            (mangled) names to be remapped. */
   12922             : #endif /* REDEFINE_EXTNAME_PRAGMA_ENABLED */
   12923             : #if SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12924             :   pk_enable_ldscope,
   12925             :   pk_disable_ldscope,
   12926             : #endif /* SUN_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12927             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12928             :   pk_gcc,
   12929             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12930             :   pk_diag_suppress,
   12931             :   pk_diag_remark,
   12932             :   pk_diag_warning,
   12933             :   pk_diag_error,
   12934             :   pk_diag_once,
   12935             :   pk_diag_default,      /* Pragmas to control the issuing of diagnostics. */
   12936             : #if INCLUDE_EDG_TEST_PRAGMAS
   12937             :   /* For testing purposes. */
   12938             :   pk_test_next_statement,
   12939             :   pk_test_next_decl,
   12940             :   pk_test_immediate,
   12941             :   pk_test_immediate_text,
   12942             :   pk_test_immediate_pp_text,
   12943             :   pk_test_other,
   12944             :   pk_test_bind_next_pass,
   12945             : #endif /* INCLUDE_EDG_TEST_PRAGMAS */
   12946             : #if ADD_CHECKING_PRAGMAS_FOR_INTERNAL_TESTING
   12947             :   /* Used for internal testing. */
   12948             :   pk_checking_pragma,
   12949             : #endif /* ADD_CHECKING_PRAGMAS_FOR_INTERNAL_TESTING */
   12950             : #if DEBUG
   12951             :   pk_db_opt,            /* Used to specify a debugging option string. */
   12952             :   pk_db_name,           /* Used to specify a debug entity name. */
   12953             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   12954             : #if GENERATE_MICROSOFT_IF_EXISTS_ENTRIES
   12955             :   pk_if_exists,         /* Used in the implementation of the Microsoft
   12956             :                            __if_exists feature. */
   12957             : #endif /* GENERATE_MICROSOFT_IF_EXISTS_ENTRIES */
   12958             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   12959             :   pk_push_macro,
   12960             :   pk_pop_macro,
   12961             :   pk_start_map_region,
   12962             :   pk_stop_map_region,
   12963             : #if NATIVE_MULTIBYTE_CHARS_SUPPORTED_WITH_UNICODE
   12964             :   pk_setlocale,
   12965             : #endif /* NATIVE_MULTIBYTE_CHARS_SUPPORTED_WITH_UNICODE */
   12966             :   pk_comment,
   12967             :   pk_conform,
   12968             :   pk_include_alias,
   12969             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   12970             : #if INCLUDE_UNRECOGNIZED_PRAGMAS_IN_IL
   12971             :   pk_unrecognized,      /* This pragma kind is used for pragmas that are
   12972             :                            not recognized by the front end but are to be
   12973             :                            recorded as a character string and passed to
   12974             :                            the back end.  These will typically be emitted
   12975             :                            by the C or C++ generating back end.  See the
   12976             :                            comments in pragma_init for information about
   12977             :                            the type of pragma that is created for an
   12978             :                            unrecognized pragma. */
   12979             : #endif /* INCLUDE_UNRECOGNIZED_PRAGMAS_IN_IL */
   12980             : 
   12981             :   /* The preceding pragma kinds are required for the default
   12982             :      implementation of the EDG front end.  If additional pragma kinds
   12983             :      are supplied for a given implementation, be sure to update
   12984             :      pragma_ids, a_pragma (if variant fields are required), and
   12985             :      alloc_pragma (which initializes the variant part of a_pragma),
   12986             :      and add an entry to the pragma_kind_descriptions list using one
   12987             :      of the add_..._pragma_kind_description routines. */
   12988             : 
   12989             :   pk_last               /* Must be last. */
   12990             : };
   12991             : #endif
   12992             :

   13230             : void
   13231           0 : summarize_pragma ( a_pragma_ptr ptr )
   13232             :    {
   13233             :   /* Description of an EDG a_pragma_ptr */
   13234             : 
   13235             : #if 0
   13236             :   a_pragma_ptr  next;
   13237             :                         /* Next in a linked list of pragma entries
   13238             :                            declared in the current scope. */
   13239             :   a_pragma_kind kind;
   13240             :                         /* The kind of pragma. */
   13241             :   a_byte_boolean
   13242             :                 ignore_in_back_end;
   13243             :                         /* TRUE if this pragma may be ignored by the back
   13244             :                            end if it is not recognized; the flag will be set
   13245             :                            (for example) on pragmas that are in the IL but
   13246             :                            are for use by other (earlier) phases of the
   13247             :                            compilation. */
   13248             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13249             :   a_byte_boolean
   13250             :                 is_microsoft_pragma_operator;
   13251             :                         /* TRUE if the pragma was specified using a Microsoft
   13252             :                            __pragma operator. */
   13253             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13254             :   a_tagged_pointer
   13255             :                 entity;
   13256             :                         /* A struct containing a tag and a generic pointer to
   13257             :                            the entity (statement, variable, function, etc.) to
   13258             :                            which this pragma is bound; a given pragma entry
   13259             :                            is bound to only one such entity.  If the entity's
   13260             :                            ptr field is NULL, this pragma has general effect,
   13261             :                            either globally (if it is on the pragma list for
   13262             :                            the file scope) or locally (if it is on the pragma
   13263             :                            list for a nonfile scope). */
   13264             :   a_source_position
   13265             :                 position;
   13266             :                         /* Source position of the pragma in the declaration
   13267             :                            of this pragma.  Points to the beginning of the
   13268             :                            #pragma directive. */
   13269             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   13270             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr
   13271             :                 source_sequence_entry;
   13272             :                         /* Pointer to source sequence entry that represents
   13273             :                            the place this pragma appears within the current
   13274             :                            file or function scope relative to other
   13275             :                            declarations, statements, comments, etc. */
   13276             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   13277             :   char          *pragma_text;
   13278             :                         /* For pragmas that are passed through to the
   13279             :                            back end as an uninterpreted character string,
   13280             :                            this points to the null terminated string.  The
   13281             :                            string begins with the token immediately following
   13282             :                            the #pragma keyword. */
   13283             :   union {
   13284             :     /* When kind == pk_none or refers to a "front-end-only" pragma, no variant
   13285             :        fields. */
   13286             :     /* When kind == pk_stdc: */
   13287             :     struct {
   13288             :       a_stdc_pragma_kind
   13289             :                 kind;   /* For the C99 STDC predefined pragmas, indicates
   13290             :                            the specific pragma being used. */
   13291             :       a_stdc_pragma_value
   13292             :                 value;  /* Specifies whether the attribute is being turned
   13293             :                            on, off, or reset to the default value. */
   13294             :     } stdc;
   13295             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13296             :     /* When kind == pk_upc: */
   13297             :     struct {
   13298             :       a_upc_pragma_kind
   13299             :                 kind;   /* For the UPC predefined pragmas, indicates
   13300             :                            the specific pragma being used. */
   13301             :       union {
   13302             :         a_upc_access_method
   13303             :                 access_method;
   13304             :                         /* Indicate which UPC access method ("strict" or
   13305             :                            "relaxed") was specified. */
   13306             :         a_upc_coherence_stack_operation
   13307             :                 operation;
   13308             :                         /* Indicate which UPC coherence stack operation
   13309             :                            ("save" or "restore") was specified. */
   13310             :       } value;
   13311             :     } upc;
   13312             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   13313             : #if IDENT_DIRECTIVE_AND_PRAGMA
   13314             :     /* When kind == pk_ident: */
   13315             :     a_constant_ptr
   13316             :                 ident_string;
   13317             :                         /* The string for the ident. */
   13318             : #endif /* IDENT_DIRECTIVE_AND_PRAGMA */
   13319             : #if USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING && BACK_END_IS_CP_GEN_BE
   13320             :     /* When kind == pk_pack: */
   13321             :     a_targ_alignment
   13322             :                 alignment;
   13323             :                         /* The alignment specified by the pack pragma. */
   13324             : #endif /* USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING && BACK_END_IS_CP_GEN_BE */
   13325             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   13326             :     /* When kind == pk_comment: */
   13327             :     struct {
   13328             :       a_microsoft_pragma_comment_type
   13329             :                 kind;   /* The comment type. */
   13330             :       a_constant_ptr
   13331             :                 str;    /* The comment string, NULL if none was supplied. */
   13332             :     } comment;
   13333             :     /* When kind == pk_conform: */
   13334             :     struct {
   13335             :       a_microsoft_pragma_conform_kind
   13336             :                 kind;   /* The conformance switch specified (currently, only
   13337             :                            "forScope" is available). */
   13338             :       a_bit_field
   13339             :                 on:1;   /* TRUE if the pragma explicitly enables standard
   13340             :                            for-init behavior. */
   13341             :       a_bit_field
   13342             :                 off:1;  /* TRUE if the pragma explicitly disables standard
   13343             :                            for-init behavior. */
   13344             :       a_bit_field
   13345             :                 show:1; /* TRUE if this is a conform "show" pragma. */
   13346             :       a_bit_field
   13347             :                 push:1; /* TRUE if this is a conform "push" pragma. */
   13348             :       a_bit_field
   13349             :                 pop:1;  /* TRUE if this is a conform "pop" pragma. */
   13350             :       char      *identifier;
   13351             :                         /* If an identifier was specified in the conform
   13352             :                            pragma this points to a null-terminated string
   13353             :                            representing that identifier.  NULL otherwise. */

   13535             :     {
   13536             : #if 0
   13537             :   a_bit_field   is_new:1;

   13541             :   a_bit_field   array_delete:1;
   13542             :                         /* TRUE if this is an array delete. */
   13543             :   a_bit_field   global_new_or_delete:1;
   13544             :                         /* TRUE if the "::" scope qualifier was used. */

   13546             :                         /* For a new, TRUE if the operator has an explicit
   13547             :                            initializer. So, for example, TRUE for new int(0)
   13548             :                            and new int(), but FALSE for new int. */

   13550             :                         /* When has_new_initializer is TRUE, this is TRUE if
   13551             :                            the new-initializer is enclosed in braces, e.g.,
   13552             :                            new int{1}. */

   13555             :                            the type to be allocated was specified by way of

   13718             : void
   13719           0 : summarize_exception_specification_type ( an_exception_specification_type_ptr ptr )
   13720             :    {
   13721             :   /* Description of an EDG an_exception_specification_type_ptr */
   13722             : 
   13723             : #if 0
   13724             : typedef struct an_exception_specification_type {
   13725             :   an_exception_specification_type_ptr
   13726             :                 next;
   13727             :                         /* Pointer to the next in the linked list of
   13728             :                            exception specification type entries, or NULL for
   13729             :                            the last entry on the list. */
   13730             :   a_type_ptr    type;
   13731             :                         /* A pointer to the type of the exception. */
   13732             :   a_byte_boolean
   13733             :                 redundant;
   13734             :                         /* TRUE when a previous entry on the list has the same
   13735             :                            type. */
   13736             :   a_byte_boolean
   13737             :                 is_pack_expansion;
