   13766             : #if 0
   13767             : /* an_exception_specification is an entry that describes an exception
   13768             :    specification on a function declaration. */
   13769             : typedef struct an_exception_specification *an_exception_specification_ptr;
   13770             : typedef struct an_exception_specification {
   13771             :   a_bit_field
   13772             :                 is_noexcept:1;
   13773             :                         /* TRUE if the exception specification is a C++11-
   13774             :                            style noexcept form. */
   13775             :   a_bit_field
   13776             :                 indeterminate:1;
   13777             :                         /* TRUE if the exception specification has not been
   13778             :                            determined yet.  (Only possible with generated
   13779             :                            special member functions.) */
   13780             :   a_bit_field
   13781             :                 throw_any:1;
   13782             :                         /* TRUE if "noexcept(<false-constant>)" or the
   13783             :                            Microsoft extension "throw (...)" was encountered.
   13784             :                            Also TRUE if a noexcept-specifier has a template-
   13785             :                            dependent argument.  It indicates that any exception
   13786             :                            may be thrown. */
   13787             :   a_bit_field
   13788             :                 compiler_generated:1;
   13789             :                         /* TRUE for exception specifications that did not
   13790             :                            appear in the source code. */
   13791             :   a_bit_field
   13792             :                 arg_cached:1;
   13793             :                         /* TRUE while the parenthesized argument tokens of the
   13794             :                            exception specification are cached for later
   13795             :                            rescanning.  In the case of members of class
   13796             :                            templates, this rescanning may never occur if the
   13797             :                            member is never used. */
   13798             :   union {

   13800             :     struct a_token_cache
   13801             :                 *token_cache;

   14074           0 : void summarize_il_header ( an_il_header & p )
   14075             :    {
   14076             : #if 0
   14077             :   a_source_file_ptr
   14078             :                 primary_source_file;
   14079             :                         /* The description of the primary source file,
   14080             :                            and linkage to include file information.  In
   14081             :                            the front end, when there are secondary translation
   14082             :                            units, this is a list of the top-level files,
   14083             :                            one for each translation unit. */
   14084             :   a_scope_ptr   primary_scope;
   14085             :                         /* The file scope, and from there all the subscopes. */
   14086             :   a_routine_ptr main_routine;
   14087             :                         /* If "main" is defined in this compilation, this
   14088             :                            points to its routine entry.  Otherwise, it
   14089             :                            is NULL. */
   14090             :   char          *compiler_version;
   14091             :                         /* A string that identifies the compiler version. */
   14092             :   char          *time_of_compilation;
   14093             :                         /* A string that identifies the time of compilation. */
   14094             :   a_byte_boolean
   14095             :                 plain_chars_are_signed;
   14096             :                         /* TRUE if the plain char type is signed. */
   14097             :   a_scope_ptr   *region_scope_entry;
   14098             :                         /* Pointer to an array of scope pointers.
   14099             :                            region_scope_entry[i] points to the scope entry
   14100             :                            for memory region i, or is NULL if the region's
   14101             :                            intermediate language is not currently in memory.
   14102             :                            Entry [0] is not used.  Note that this is a
   14103             :                            strange data structure because the pointers can
   14104             :                            point down into other memory regions; obviously,
   14105             :                            this table is handled specially by memory management
   14106             :                            and in writing and reading the IL.  We are counting
   14107             :                            on default initialization of this field to NULL. */
   14108             : #if SCOPE_ORPHANED_LIST_PROCESSING_NEEDED
   14109             :   a_scope_orphaned_list_header_ptr
   14110             :                 scope_orphaned_list_headers;
   14111             :                         /* Pointer to a list of entries that point to lists
   14112             :                            of "orphaned" file scope IL entries -- entries
   14113             :                            whose parents are in a function scope memory
   14114             :                            region. */
   14115             : #endif /* SCOPE_ORPHANED_LIST_PROCESSING_NEEDED */
   14116             :   a_source_language
   14117             :                 source_language;
   14118             :                         /* Code for the language in which the source program
   14119             :                            is written. */
   14120             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   14121             :   a_cli_metadata_file_ptr
   14122             :                 cli_metadata_files;
   14123             :                         /* A list of all metadata files made available to the
   14124             :                            compilation.  These may have been made available by
   14125             :                            an explicit #using (as in a #using that
   14126             :                            appears in the source), or an implicit #using (as
   14127             :                            can be the case with mscorlib, a metadata file named
   14128             :                            with the preusing option, or referenced indirectly
   14129             :                            as part of a multi-file assembly). */
   14130             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   14131             :   a_byte_boolean
   14132             :                 pcc_compatibility_mode;
   14133             :                         /* TRUE if the source program was compiled as old-style
   14134             :                            (pcc-compatible) C. */
   14135             :   a_byte_boolean
   14136             :                 c99_mode;
   14137             :                         /* TRUE if the source program was compiled as C99. */
   14138             :   a_byte_boolean
   14139             :                 enum_type_is_integral;
   14140             :                         /* Records whether enum types are considered to be
   14141             :                            integral; normally, TRUE in C mode and FALSE in
   14142             :                            C++ mode. */
   14143             : #if USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING
   14144             :   a_targ_alignment
   14145             :                 default_max_member_alignment;
   14146             :                         /* If nonzero, the maximum alignment of any nonstatic
   14147             :                            data member of a class, struct, or union, unless a
   14148             :                            "#pragma pack" overrides it.  Its value is based
   14149             :                            on command-line option "--pack_alignment".  (A zero
   14150             :                            value means that a member's alignment is based
   14151             :                            solely on its type.) */
   14152             : #endif /* USER_CONTROL_OF_STRUCT_PACKING */

   14444             : // DQ (9/17/2018): Adding debugging support for source file details.
   14445           0 : void summarize_source_file ( const a_source_file_ptr & ptr )
   14446             :    {
   14447             : #if 0
   14448             :   /* Information about a source file used by the compilation.  A tree of
   14449             :      these represents the full history of source file compilation and
   14450             :      inclusion, and is also used to turn a sequence number into a file name
   14451             :      and line number pair.  Also used to indicate remapping due to #line
   14452             :      directives: an entry appears for each line sequence remapped in
   14453             :      that way, with first_line_number set appropriately. */
   14454             :   a_const_char  *file_name;
   14455             :                         /* The display form of the file name.  May be the
   14456             :                            same address as full_name (but NOT a pointer to
   14457             :                            the tail of the full_name string).  Null-terminated.
   14458             :                            This is the form of the name to be used in error
   14459             :                            messages and the like. */
   14460             :   a_const_char  *full_name;
   14461             :                         /* The actual file name of the file.  Null-terminated.
   14462             :                            NULL for entries generated by #line directives. */
   14463             :   a_const_char  *name_as_written;
   14464             :                         /* The name as specified on the command line or in a
   14465             :                            #include or #using directive, including a path (if
   14466             :                            any).  Null-terminated.  Note that it is not
   14467             :                            necessarily the same as full_name with the directory
   14468             :                            path stripped off -- for instance, full_name may be
   14469             :                            "path/xxx/abc.h" when ``#include "xxx/abc.h"''
   14470             :                            appears in the source. */
   14471             :   a_seq_number  first_seq_number,
   14472             :                 last_seq_number;

   14474             :                            file and include files within it.  The first
   14475             :                            is larger than the last if the file has zero lines.
   14476             :                            A value of MAX_SEQ_NUMBER for the last indicates
   14477             :                            that the final number is not yet known. */
   14478             :   a_line_number first_line_number;

   14480             :                            first_seq_number.  Has the value 1 for entries
   14481             :                            not generated by #line directives. */

   14486             :                            source file, in order.  Both pointers are NULL
   14487             :                            if the present file references no include files.
   14488             :                            The list is linked on the "next" link. */
   14489             :   a_source_file_ptr
   14490             :                 next;
   14491             :                         /* The next include file referenced by the parent
   14492             :                            of this file, or NULL if there is no next file. */
   14493             : #if INSTANTIATION_BY_IMPLICIT_INCLUSION
   14494             :   a_bit_field   related_file_implicit_include_done:1;

   14496             :                            been made to implicitly include the source file

   14498             :                            file.  This is set to TRUE even if the attempt
   14499             :                            failed (e.g., the file does not exist). */
   14500             :   a_bit_field   is_implicit_include:1;

   14502             :                            a template definition.  FALSE for assemblies. */
   14503             : #endif /* INSTANTIATION_BY_IMPLICIT_INCLUSION */
   14504             :   a_bit_field   is_include_file:1;

   14509             :                            source files from which precompiled header
   14510             :                            information has been restored. */

   14522             :                            included by the preinclude_macros option, and
   14523             :                            from which only macro definitions should be
   14524             :                            considered.  FALSE for assemblies. */
   14525             :   a_bit_field   from_system_include_dir:1;
   14526             :                         /* TRUE if this source file was found in an include
   14527             :                            directory marked as a "system" include directory.
   14528             :                            Warnings are suppressed when processing system
   14529             :                            include directories.  This is also set for a file
   14530             :                            included using an absolute path name by a file
   14531             :                            that has its from_system_include_dir flag set.
   14532             :                            Always FALSE for assemblies. */
   14533             :   a_bit_field   top_level_file:1;
   14534             :                         /* TRUE if this file is a top-level file, i.e., it
   14535             :                            wasn't included by another file.  TRUE for the
   14536             :                            primary source file and for secondary files

   14542             :   a_bit_field   top_level_file_from_pch:1;
   14543             :                         /* When top_level_file is TRUE, this field is TRUE
   14544             :                            for a file that is a primary source file
   14545             :                            associated with a precompiled header file that is
   14546             :                            being used. */
   14547             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   14548             :   a_bit_field   is_assembly_file:1;
   14549             :                         /* TRUE if the source file is a C++/CLI assembly.
   14550             :                            Assembly source files don't use the "normal" input
   14551             :                            mechanism; the sequence number information includes
   14552             :                            a single sequence number (i.e., first_seq_number ==
   14553             :                            last_seq_number) and this sequence number is used
   14554             :                            for all tokens scanned from the file. */
   14555             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   14556             : #endif
   14557             :

   14604             : // DQ (1/2/2014): Adding debugging support for macros.
   14605           0 : void summarize_macro_invocation_record ( a_macro_invocation_record_ptr ptr )
   14606             :    {
   14607             : #if 0
   14608             : typedef struct a_macro_invocation_record {
   14609             :   a_macro_invocation_record_index
   14610             :                 parent_macro_index;
   14611             :                         /* If non-negative, the index in the macro invocation
   14612             :                            tree of the macro invocation record for the macro
   14613             :                            expansion in which this macro invocation occurred.
   14614             :                            If equal to NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION, this macro
   14615             :                            invocation occurred directly in program text.
   14616             :                            All other negative values indicate that this
   14617             :                            macro invocation record does not denote an actual
   14618             :                            macro invocation but is simply a placeholder
   14619             :                            specifying the number of levels of nesting that
   14620             :                            are to be popped in the transition to the next
   14621             :                            record.  (A single-level pop is implicit.) */
   14622             :   a_macro_ptr   assoc_macro;
   14623             :                         /* The macro whose expansion this invocation record
   14624             :                            represents.  Will be NULL for negative values of
   14625             :                            parent_macro_index other than
   14626             :                            NO_PARENT_MACRO_INVOCATION. */
   14627             :   a_simple_source_position
   14628             :                 start;  /* The original location of the macro name for this
   14629             :                            invocation (i.e., if this invocation occurs in
   14630             :                            the expansion of another, this position will be in
   14631             :                            either a macro definition line or in a macro
   14632             :                            argument). */
   14633             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   14634             :   a_simple_source_position
   14635             :                 end;    /* The original location of the last character of the
   14636             :                            macro invocation -- i.e., the last character of the
   14637             :                            name for an object-like macro or the position of
   14638             :                            the closing parenthesis for a function-like
   14639             :                            macro. */
   14640             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   14641             : #endif

   14701           0 : void summarize_macro_invocation_record_block ( a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr ptr )

   14703             : #if 0
   14704             : typedef struct a_macro_invocation_record_block {
   14705             :   a_macro_invocation_record_index
   14706             :                 first_record_in_block;
   14707             :                         /* The index represented by the first macro invocation
   14708             :                            record in this block.  That is, the array of macro
   14709             :                            invocation records represents the range of indices
   14710             :                            from first_record_in_block up through
   14711             :                            first_record_in_block +
   14712             :                            MACRO_INVOCATION_RECORDS_PER_BLOCK-1. */
   14713             :   a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr
   14714             :                 left_subtree;
   14715             :                         /* Pointer to a binary tree containing all the macro
   14716             :                            invocation records whose indices are less than that
   14717             :                            of the first record in this block (NULL if
   14718             :                            first_record_in_block is 0). */
   14719             :   a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr
   14720             :                 right_subtree;
   14721             :                         /* Pointer to a binary tree containing all the macro
   14722             :                            invocation records whose indices are greater than
   14723             :                            that of the last record in this block (NULL if this
   14724             :                            block contains the last invocation record in this
   14725             :                            subtree). */
   14726             :   a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr

   14729             :                            list, or NULL for the first block in the list. */
   14730             :   a_macro_invocation_record_block_ptr

   14732             :                         /* Pointer to the next block in the doubly-linked
   14733             :                            list, or NULL for the last block in the list. */

   14735             :                 records[MACRO_INVOCATION_RECORDS_PER_BLOCK];
   14736             :                         /* The macro invocation records for this block. */
   14737             : #endif

   15065             : string
   15066           0 : attribute_family_to_string (a_byte_attribute_family family)
   15067             :    {
   15068             : #if 0
   15069             :   /* Attributes can be specified using different syntactical constructs.  Each
   15070             :      construct kind corresponds to a "family" of attributes. */
   15071             :   af_internal,          /* To annotate IL properties that do not come from an
   15072             :                            attribute-like construct.  E.g., on a template this
   15073             :                            might reflect the effect of a #pragma directive. */
   15074             :   af_std,               /* An attribute specified using the standard C++11
   15075             :                            syntax [[ ... ]]. */
   15076             :   af_gnu,               /* An attribute specified using the GNU __attribute
   15077             :                            syntax.  (The GNU syntax is emulated by other
   15078             :                            compilers, including Sun's.) */
   15079             :   af_ms_declspec,       /* An attribute specified using the Microsoft
   15080             :                            __declspec construct. */
   15081             :   af_alignas,   /* The C++11 attribute-like construct "alignas". */
   15082             :   af_last               /*lint -esym(769,an_attribute_family_tag::af_last)*/
   15083             : #endif
   15084             : 
   15085           0 :      string s = "unknown";
   15086             : 
   15087           0 :      switch (family)
   15088             :         {
   15089           0 :           case af_internal:    s = "af_internal";    break;
   15090           0 :           case af_std:         s = "af_std";         break;
   15091           0 :           case af_gnu:         s = "af_gnu";         break;
   15092           0 :           case af_ms_declspec: s = "af_ms_declspec"; break;
   15093             : #if ((ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER == 4) && (ROSE_EDG_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER >= 9) ) || (ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER > 4)
   15094           0 :           case af_alignas:     s = "af_alignas";     break;
   15095             : #endif
   15096           0 :           case af_last:        s = "af_last";        break;
   15097             : 
   15098           0 :           default: 
   15099           0 :              {
   15100           0 :                printf ("In attribute_family_to_string(%" PRIuPTR "): default reached \n",(size_t)family);
   15101           0 :                ROSE_ASSERT(false);
   15102             :              }
   15103             :         }
   15104             : 
   15105           0 :      return s;
   15106             :    }
   15107             : 
   15108             : string
   15109           0 : attribute_syntactic_location_to_string (a_byte_attribute_location location)
   15110             :    {
   15111             : #if 0
   15112             :   al_implicit,          /* The attribute did not appear explicitly in the
   15113             :                            source. */
   15114             :   al_prefix,            /* The attribute is the first element of a declaration
   15115             :                            (including an empty declaration), using-directive,
   15116             :                            label, or statement. */
   15117             :   al_tag_name,          /* The attribute appears after "enum", "struct",
   15118             :                            "union", or "class" but before the definition of
   15119             :                            that associated entity. */
   15120             :   al_post_tag_definition,
   15121             :                         /* The attribute appears after a class definition
   15122             :                            (possible only with GNU attributes). */
   15123             :   al_base_specifier,    /* The attribute appears in a base class specifier or
   15124             :                            in an explicit enum base type specifier. */
   15125             :   al_specifier,         /* The attribute is part of the declaration
   15126             :                            specifiers. */
   15127             :   al_declarator_id,     /* The attribute is directly associated with the
   15128             :                            declarator-id. */
   15129             :   al_post_ptr_or_ref,   /* The attribute immediately follows a pointer,
   15130             :                            reference, or pointer-to-member declarator
   15131             :                            operator.  (Standard attributes only.) */
   15132             :   al_post_array,        /* The attribute immediately follows an array
   15133             :                            declarator.  (Standard attributes only.) */
   15134             :   al_post_func,         /* The attribute immediately follows a function
   15135             :                            declarator.  (Standard attributes only.) */
   15136             :   al_postfix,           /* The attribute follows the top-level declarator.
   15137             :                            (GNU attributes only; al_postfix attributes have
   15138             :                            the same effect as al_declarator_id attributes.) */
   15139             :   al_predeclarator,
   15140             :                         /* The attribute appeared as the first construct of a
   15141             :                            nested declarator (GNU attributes only).  E.g.:
   15142             :                               int (__attribute((cdecl)) **pf)();
   15143             :                            Such an attribute applies to the type "underneath"
   15144             :                            the declarator (type "int()" in this example). */
   15145             :   al_id_equivalent,     /* The attribute appeared in an unusual place, but
   15146             :                            is treated as if it were a declarator-id attribute.
   15147             :                            (GNU attributes only.)  E.g.,
   15148             :                                int* __attribute((weak)) f() { return 0; }
   15149             :                            In this example, the attribute couldn't appear as
   15150             :                            a postfix attribute (because GCC doesn't allow
   15151             :                            postfix attributes on function definitions).  In
   15152             :                            cases with multiple declarators, a prefix attribute
   15153             :                            would not be appropriate either. */
   15154             :   al_trailing_return,   /* The attribute is the first element of a trailing
   15155             :                            return type. */
   15156             :   al_post_initializer,  /* The attribute follows a parenthesized initializer
   15157             :                            (allowed in some GNU C++ modes only). */
   15158             :   al_namespace,         /* The attribute appears on a namespace definition. */
   15159             :   al_label,             /* The attribute follows a label name in a label
   15160             :                            declaration. */
   15161             :   al_explicit,          /* This value is never recorded in attribute entries,
   15162             :                            but it is passed into some routines to indicate
   15163             :                            that an operation should apply to all non-implicit
   15164             :                            attributes. */
   15165             :   al_id_equivalent_as_postfix,
   15166             :                         /* This value is never recorded in attribute entries,
   15167             :                            but it is used by the C++-generating back end to
   15168             :                            match al_id_equivalent attributes when they are
   15169             :                            being generated in the postfix position. */
   15170             :   al_last
   15171             : #endif
   15172             : 
   15173           0 :      string s = "unknown";
   15174             : 
   15175           0 :      switch (location)
   15176             :         {
   15177           0 :           case al_implicit:                 s = "al_implicit"; break;
   15178           0 :           case al_prefix:                   s = "al_prefix"; break;
   15179           0 :           case al_tag_name:                 s = "al_tag_name"; break;
   15180           0 :           case al_post_tag_definition:      s = "al_post_tag_definition"; break;
   15181           0 :           case al_base_specifier:           s = "al_base_specifier"; break;
   15182           0 :           case al_specifier:                s = "al_specifier"; break;
   15183           0 :           case al_declarator_id:            s = "al_declarator_id"; break;
   15184           0 :           case al_post_ptr_or_ref:          s = "al_post_ptr_or_ref"; break;
   15185           0 :           case al_post_array:               s = "al_post_array"; break;
   15186           0 :           case al_post_func:                s = "al_post_func"; break;
   15187           0 :           case al_postfix:                  s = "al_postfix"; break;
   15188           0 :           case al_predeclarator:            s = "al_predeclarator"; break;
   15189           0 :           case al_id_equivalent:            s = "al_id_equivalent"; break;
   15190           0 :           case al_trailing_return:          s = "al_trailing_return"; break;
   15191           0 :           case al_post_initializer:         s = "al_post_initializer"; break;

   15194           0 :           case al_explicit:                 s = "al_explicit"; break;

   15209             : string
   15210           0 : attribute_arg_kind_to_string (an_attribute_arg_kind kind)
   15211             :    {
   15212             : #if 0
   15213             :   /* An attribute argument entry can represent several kinds of arguments. */
   15214             :   aak_empty,            /* If an attribute has an empty argument list, that
   15215             :                            list is represented by a single aak_empty entry.
   15216             :                            (E.g., __attribute(( nonnull() )) has an aak_empty
   15217             :                            argument, but __attribute((nonnull)) has no
   15218             :                            attribute arguments at all.)  An aak_empty entry
   15219             :                            is also appended after a sequence of aak_raw_token
   15220             :                            entries. */
   15221             :   aak_raw_token,        /* Raw tokens are used for unrecognized attributes in
   15222             :                            particular, and can include commas.  E.g., (z, =)
   15223             :                            could be represented with three raw tokens: "z",
   15224             :                            "," and "=".  A sequence of raw tokens is terminated
   15225             :                            by an aak_empty entry. */
   15226             :   aak_token,            /* A single token argument.  E.g., (z, =) could be
   15227             :                            represented with two tokens: "z" and "=". */
   15228             :   aak_constant,         /* A constant argument. */
   15229             :   aak_type,             /* A type argument. */
   15230             :   aak_last
   15231             : #endif
   15232             : 
   15233           0 :      string s = "unknown";
   15234             : 
   15235           0 :      switch (kind)
   15236             :         {
   15237           0 :           case aak_empty:     s = "aak_empty"; break;
   15238           0 :           case aak_raw_token: s = "aak_raw_token"; break;
   15239           0 :           case aak_token:     s = "aak_token"; break;
   15240           0 :           case aak_constant:  s = "aak_constant"; break;
   15241           0 :           case aak_type:      s = "aak_type"; break;
   15242             : 
   15243           0 :           case aak_last:      s = "aak_last"; break;
   15244             : 
   15245           0 :           default: 
   15246           0 :              {
   15247           0 :                printf ("In attribute_family_to_string(%" PRIuPTR "): default reached \n",(size_t)kind);
   15248           0 :                ROSE_ASSERT(false);
   15249             :              }
   15250             :         }
   15251             : 
   15252           0 :      return s;
   15253             :    }
   15254             : 
   15255             : #if 0
   15256             : string
   15257             : attribute_arg_kind_to_string (a_small_token_kind kind)
   15258             :    {
   15259             : #if 0
   15260             : #endif
   15261             : 
   15262             :      string s = "unknown";

   15280             : 
   15281             : // DQ (1/2/2014): Adding debugging support for macros.
   15282           0 : void summarize_attribute_arg ( an_attribute_arg_ptr ptr )
   15283             :    {
   15284             : #if 0
   15285             :   /* Structure to represent the arguments of an attribute.  Each argument
   15286             :      corresponds to one entry, but an entry is also produced for an empty
   15287             :      argument list ("()" as opposed to ""). */
   15288             :   an_attribute_arg_ptr
   15289             :                 next;
   15290             :                         /* Next in a linked list of attribute arguments. */
   15291             :   an_attribute_arg_kind
   15292             :                 kind;
   15293             :                         /* The kind of argument this represents. */
   15294             :   a_source_position
   15295             :                 position;
   15296             :                         /* The source position of the argument. */
   15297             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15298             :   a_source_position
   15299             :                 end_position;
   15300             :                         /* The position of the end of the argument. */
   15301             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15302             :   a_small_token_kind
   15303             :                 token_kind;
   15304             :                         /* For aak_token or aak_raw_token entries, the token
   15305             :                            kind that was scanned.  Otherwise, tok_last. */
   15306             :   union {
   15307             :     /* When kind == aak_empty: no variant fields. */
   15308             :     /* When kind == aak_token or aak_raw_token: */
   15309             :     char        *token; /* The character sequence forming the argument token. */
   15310             :     /* When kind == aak_constant: */
   15311             :     a_constant_ptr
   15312             :                 constant;
   15313             :                         /* The argument constant. */
   15314             :     /* When kind == aak_type: */
   15315             :     a_type_ptr
   15316             :                 type;   /* The argument type. */
   15317             :   } variant;
   15318             : #endif
   15319             : 
   15320           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT(ptr != NULL);
   15321             : 
   15322           0 :      printf ("     next                                 = %p \n",ptr->next);
   15323           0 :      printf ("     kind (enum value)                    = %" PRIuPTR " \n",(size_t)ptr->kind);
   15324           0 :      printf ("     kind (name)                          = %s \n",attribute_arg_kind_to_string(ptr->kind).c_str());
   15325             : 
   15326           0 :      printf ("     position: \n");
   15327           0 :      summarize_source_position(ptr->position);
   15328             : 
   15329             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15330           0 :      printf ("     end_position: \n");
   15331           0 :      summarize_source_position(ptr->end_position);
   15332             : #endif
   15333             : 
   15334           0 :      printf ("     token_kind                           = %" PRIuPTR " \n",(size_t)ptr->token_kind);
   15335             :   // printf ("     token_kind                           = %s \n",attribute_arg_token_kind_to_string(ptr->token_kind).c_str());
   15336             :   // printf ("     token_kind                           = %" PRIuPTR " \n",(size_t)ptr->token_kind);
   15337             : 
   15338           0 :      if (ptr->kind != aak_empty)
   15339             :         {
   15340           0 :           if (ptr->kind == aak_token || ptr->kind == aak_raw_token)
   15341             :              {
   15342           0 :                printf ("     token (pointer)                      = %p \n",ptr->variant.token);
   15343           0 :                if (ptr->variant.token != NULL)
   15344             :                   {
   15345           0 :                     printf ("     token (string)                       = %s \n",ptr->variant.token);
   15346             :                   }
   15347             :              }
   15348             : 
   15349           0 :           if (ptr->kind == aak_constant)
   15350             :              {
   15351           0 :                printf ("     constant                            = %p \n",ptr->variant.constant);
   15352           0 :                if (ptr->variant.constant != NULL)
   15353             :                   {
   15354             : #if 0
   15355             :                  // DQ (7/24/2014): This is the more detailed output, but which is not frequently required.
   15356             :                     printf ("     In summarize_attribute_arg(): calling summarize_constant() \n");
   15357             :                     summarize_constant(ptr->variant.constant);
   15358             : #else
   15359           0 :                     printf ("     In summarize_attribute_arg(): skip calling summarize_constant() \n");
   15360             : #endif
   15361             :                   }
   15362             :              }
   15363             : 
   15364           0 :           if (ptr->kind == aak_type)
   15365             :              {
   15366           0 :                printf ("     type                                = %p \n",ptr->variant.type);
   15367           0 :                if (ptr->variant.type != NULL)
   15368             :                   {
   15369           0 :                     summarize_type(ptr->variant.type);
   15370             :                   }
   15371             :              }
   15372             :         }
   15373             :        else
   15374             :         {
   15375             :        // No variant fields.
   15376             :         }
   15377             :      
   15378           0 :    }

   15380             : // DQ (1/2/2014): Adding debugging support for macros.
   15381           0 : void summarize_attribute_group ( an_attribute_group_ptr ptr )
   15382             :    {
   15383             : #if 0
   15384             :   /* Structure to represent an attribute group.  E.g., [[noreturn]] or
   15385             :      [[noreturn, final]] in C++11, or __attribute((noreturn)) in GNU modes.
   15386             :      Note that attribute groups do not appear on lists, nor are they pointed
   15387             :      to directly by entities to which they apply.  Instead, the entities
   15388             :      point to the attributes contained by the group, and those attributes
   15389             :      point to a group.  This is expected to be the most convenient approach
   15390             :      for most applications. */
   15391             :   a_source_position
   15392             :                 position;
   15393             :                         /* The source position of the first token of the
   15394             :                            attribute group construct (e.g., the first '['
   15395             :                            for the standard attribute syntax or the
   15396             :                            '__attribute' token for the GNU syntax). */
   15397             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15398             :   a_source_position
   15399             :                 end_position;
   15400             :                         /* The end position of the last token of the attribute
   15401             :                            group construct (e.g., the last ']' in the standard
   15402             :                            attribute syntax). */
   15403             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15404             : #endif
   15405             : 
   15406           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT(ptr != NULL);
   15407             : 
   15408           0 :      printf ("     position: \n");
   15409           0 :      summarize_source_position(ptr->position);
   15410             : 
   15411             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15412           0 :      printf ("     end_position: \n");
   15413           0 :      summarize_source_position(ptr->end_position);
   15414             : #endif
   15415           0 :    }

   15418             : // DQ (1/2/2014): Adding debugging support for macros.
   15419           0 : void summarize_attribute ( an_attribute_ptr ptr )
   15420             :    {
   15421             : #if 0
   15422             :   an_attribute_ptr
   15423             :                 next;
   15424             :                         /* Next in a linked list of attributes. */
   15425             :   a_byte_attribute_kind
   15426             :                 kind;
   15427             :                         /* The specific of attribute that was encountered. */
   15428             :   a_byte_attribute_family
   15429             :                 family; /* The kind of construct that was used to express the
   15430             :                            attribute in the source. */
   15431             :   a_byte_attribute_location
   15432             :                 syntactic_location;
   15433             :                         /* The syntactic location of the attribute. */
   15434             :   a_bit_field   on_primary_declaration:1;
   15435             :                         /* The attribute appeared on the primary declaration of
   15436             :                            an entity.  (Some attributes on a definition take
   15437             :                            precedence over the same attribute applied to
   15438             :                            another declaration of the same entity.)  For base
   15439             :                            class entries, these are the attributes that were
   15440             :                            specified on the base class specifier. */
   15441             :   a_bit_field   transforms_type_specifier:1;
   15442             :                         /* TRUE if this attribute appertains to a type
   15443             :                            specifier and produces a new type as a result.
   15444             :                            Currently, this is only TRUE for GNU mode and
   15445             :                            vector_size attributes. */
   15446             :   a_bit_field   must_be_preserved_in_trans_unit_copy:1;
   15447             :                         /* A front-end-only flag indicating that this attribute
   15448             :                            should be preserved in the merged entity produced
   15449             :                            by the trans_copy process.  FALSE means it is a
   15450             :                            duplicate of something in another translation unit
   15451             :                            and will be discarded. */
   15452             :   a_bit_field   is_pack_expansion:1;
   15453             :                         /* TRUE if the attribute is a variadic template pack
   15454             :                            expansion, i.e., it's followed by "...". */
   15455             :   char          *name;  /* The attribute name as it appeared in the source.
   15456             :                            E.g. "aligned" for __attribute((aligned(8))). */
   15457             :   char          *namespace_name;
   15458             :                         /* The attribute namespace name as it appeared in the
   15459             :                            source.  E.g., "XYZ" in [[ XYZ::fast ]].  NULL if
   15460             :                            no namespace name appeared (in particular, NULL
   15461             :                            when family is not af_std). */
   15462             :   an_attribute_arg_ptr
   15463             :                 arguments;
   15464             :                         /* The argument list of this attribute (NULL if there
   15465             :                            are no arguments). */
   15466             :   an_attribute_group_ptr
   15467             :                 group;
   15468             :                         /* The attribute group this attribute belongs to.
   15469             :                            (NULL for attribute families that don't have a
   15470             :                            notion of grouping.) */
   15471             :   void          *assoc_info;
   15472             :                         /* Additional attribute-specific information (NULL if
   15473             :                            there is none).  The value recorded here by the
   15474             :                            front end (if any) is not for use by a back end.
   15475             :                            However, back ends can make use of this field for
   15476             :                            their own purposes. */
   15477             :   a_source_position
   15478             :                 position;
   15479             :                         /* The position of the attribute. */
   15480             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   15481             :   a_source_position
   15482             :                 end_position;
   15483             :                         /* The position of the end of the attribute. */
   15484             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   15485             : 
   15486             : #endif
   15487             : 
   15488           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT(ptr != NULL);
   15489             : 
   15490           0 :      printf ("     next                                 = %p \n",ptr->next);
   15491           0 :      printf ("     kind (enum value)                    = %" PRIuPTR " \n",(size_t)ptr->kind);

   15496           0 :      printf ("     syntactic location                   = %" PRIuPTR " \n",(size_t)ptr->syntactic_location);

   15499           0 :      printf ("     on_primary_declaration               = %s \n",ptr->on_primary_declaration    ? "true" : "false");

   15503             : 
   15504           0 :      printf ("     name                                 = %s \n",ptr->name != NULL ? ptr->name : "null");
   15505           0 :      printf ("     namespace_name                       = %s \n",ptr->namespace_name != NULL ? ptr->namespace_name : "null");
   15506             : 
   15507           0 :      printf ("     arguments                            = %p \n",ptr->arguments);
   15508           0 :      an_attribute_arg_ptr attribute_arg = ptr->arguments;
   15509           0 :      int counter = 0;
   15510           0 :      while (attribute_arg != NULL)
   15511             :         {

   15715             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15716             : // DQ (8/16/2014): Adding support for MS attributes.
   15717             : void summarize_ms_attribute ( an_ms_attribute_ptr ptr )
   15718             :    {
   15719             : #if 0
   15720             : EDG 4.7
   15721             : typedef struct an_ms_attribute {
   15722             :   an_ms_attribute_ptr next;
   15723             :   an_ms_attribute_ptr next_in_block;
   15724             :   a_tagged_pointer entity;
   15725             : 
   15726             : x  char         *name;
   15727             : x  char         *string;
   15728             : x  an_ms_attribute_arg_ptr arg_list;
   15729             : x  a_source_position position;
   15730             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   15731             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr source_sequence_entry;
   15732             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15733             :   struct an_ms_attribute_kind_descr *kind_descr;
   15734             :   an_ms_attribute_kind kind;
   15735             : } an_ms_attribute;
   15736             : 
   15737             : 
   15738             : 
   15739             : EDG 4.9
   15740             : typedef struct an_ms_attribute {
   15741             :   an_ms_attribute_ptr next;
   15742             :   an_ms_attribute_ptr next_in_block;
   15743             :   a_tagged_pointer entity;
   15744             :   a_bit_field is_attribute_attribute:1;
   15745             :   union {
   15746             :     /* When kind != msak_custom: */
   15747             :     struct {
   15748             :       struct an_ms_attribute_kind_descr *kind_descr;
   15749             :       a_const_char *name;
   15750             :       a_const_char *string;
   15751             :       an_ms_attribute_arg_ptr arg_list;
   15752             :     } info;
   15753             :     /* When kind == msak_custom: */
   15754             :     struct {
   15755             :       a_type_ptr type;
   15756             :       a_routine_ptr constructor;
   15757             :       an_expr_node_ptr args;
   15758             :       a_custom_ms_attribute_arg_ptr named_args;
   15759             :     } custom_info;
   15760             :   } variant;
   15761             :   a_source_position position;
   15762             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
   15763             :   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr source_sequence_entry;
   15764             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
   15765             :   an_ms_attribute_kind kind;
   15766             :   an_ms_attribute_target target;
   15767             : } an_ms_attribute;
   15768             : #endif
   15769             : 
   15770             :      ROSE_ASSERT(ptr != NULL);
   15771             : 
   15772             :      printf ("     next                                           = %p \n",ptr->next);
   15773             : 
   15774             :      printf ("     next_in_block                                           = %p \n",ptr->next_in_block);
   15775             :   // printf ("     entity                                           = %p \n",ptr->entity);
   15776             :      printf ("          --- entity.kind = %d = %s \n",ptr->entity.kind,summarize_entry_kind_in_string_kind((an_il_entry_kind)(ptr->entity.kind)));
   15777             :      printf ("          --- entity.ptr  = %p \n",ptr->entity.ptr);
   15778             : #if ((ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER == 4) && (ROSE_EDG_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER >= 9) ) || (ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER > 4)
   15779             : // EDG 4.9 (and greater) version specific code.
   15780             : 
   15781             :      printf ("     is_attribute_attribute                            = %s \n",ptr->is_attribute_attribute ? "true" : "false");
   15782             : 
   15783             :      if (ptr->kind != msak_custom)
   15784             :         {

   16212             : void
   16213           0 : print_source_pos(a_source_position pos)
   16214             :    {
   16215             : // DQ (2/13/2016): Fixing the EDG 4.8 support (because we are testing it and I would like to see the tests pass, but we are not generally interested in supporting it).
   16216             : // #if ((ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER == 4) && (ROSE_EDG_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER >= 9) ) || (ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER > 4)
   16217             : #if ((ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER == 4) && (ROSE_EDG_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER >= 8) ) || (ROSE_EDG_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER > 4)
   16218             :   // DQ (10/20/2015): Note that EDG 4.9 changes the function argument types to conv_seq_to_file_and_line()
   16219             :   // And makes the typedef represented by a_const_char be "const char" for C++11 and "char" for C++98.
   16220           0 :      a_const_char* file_name_ptr_memory_location = NULL;

   16222           0 :      a_const_char** file_name = &file_name_ptr_memory_location;
   16223           0 :      a_const_char** full_name = &full_name_ptr_memory_location;
   16224             : #else
   16225             :   // This is the implementation required for EDG 4.7 to avoid compiler warnings.
   16226             :      char* file_name_ptr_memory_location = NULL;
   16227             :      char* full_name_ptr_memory_location = NULL;
   16228             :      char** file_name = &file_name_ptr_memory_location;
   16229             :      char** full_name = &full_name_ptr_memory_location;
   16230             : #endif
   16231             : 
   16232           0 :      a_line_number ln = 0;
   16233           0 :      a_boolean at_end = FALSE;
   16234             : 
   16235             :   // DQ (10/11/2016): I think that some of these values are uninitialized (and thus out of range).
   16236           0 :      if (pos.seq > 1000000)
   16237             :         {
   16238           0 :           printf ("ERROR: In print_source_pos(): pos.seq > 1000000 (and considered to be out of range, EDG 4.12 bug) \n");
   16239           0 :           return;
   16240             :         }
   16241             : 
   16242             : #if 0
   16243             :      printf ("Calling conv_seq_to_file_and_line(): pos.seq = %lu \n",pos.seq);

   16678             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   16679             :   a_variable_ptr
   16680             :                 total_number_of_elements;
   16681             :                         /* A variable (produced by lowering of statements of
   16682             :                            kind stmk_set_vla_size) holding the total number of
   16683             :                            elements in this VLA type.  For example, if type is
   16684             :                            int[n][4][m], then the variable would hold the
   16685             :                            result of computing n*4*m at the appropriate time.
   16686             :                            Valid only in the front end.  NULL until the
   16687             :                            associated stmk_set_vla_size statement has been
   16688             :                            lowered. */
   16689             : #else /* !LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   16690             :   a_variable_ptr
   16691             :                 dimension_variable;
   16692             :                         /* A variable initialized with the original expression
   16693             :                            recorded in dimension_expr.  It is used by the
   16694             :                            C-generating back end to avoid duplicating side-
   16695             :                            effects in VLA bounds.  For example, if a VLA is
   16696             :                            originally of type "int[++k]" and the C-generating
   16697             :                            back end must express this type several times, it
   16698             :                            will do so as "int[n]" where "n" is the variable
   16699             :                            recorded in this field (and initialized with "++k"
   16700             :                            at the appropriate time).  NULL for entries not
   16701             :                            pointed to by a stmk_set_vla_size statement. */
   16702             : #endif /* LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS */
   16703             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
   16704             : 
   16705             : #endif
   16706             : 
   16707           0 :      ROSE_ASSERT(ptr != NULL);
   16708             : 
   16709           0 :      printf ("In summarize_vla_dimension()                = %p \n",ptr);
   16710             : 
   16711           0 :      printf ("     next                                   = %p \n",ptr->next);
   16712           0 :      printf ("     type                                   = %p \n",ptr->type);
   16713           0 :      printf ("     dimension_expr                         = %p \n",ptr->dimension_expr);
   16714             : 
   16715           0 :      printf ("     original_dimension                     = %p \n",ptr->original_dimension);
   16716           0 :      if (ptr->original_dimension)
   16717             :         {
   16718           0 :           printf ("In summarize_vla_dimension(): nested call to summarize_vla_dimension(original_dimension) \n");
   16719           0 :           summarize_vla_dimension(ptr->original_dimension);
   16720             :         }
   16721             : 
   16722           0 :      printf ("     in_prototype_scope                     = %s \n",ptr->in_prototype_scope ? "true" : "false");
   16723             : 
   16724           0 :      printf ("     position: \n");
   16725           0 :      summarize_source_position (ptr->position);
   16726             : 
   16727             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
   16728             : #if LOWER_VARIABLE_LENGTH_ARRAYS
   16729             :      printf ("     total_number_of_elements               = %p \n",ptr->total_number_of_elements);
   16730             : #else
   16731             :      printf ("     dimension_variable                     = %p \n",ptr->dimension_variable);
   16732             : #endif
   16733             : #endif
   16734             : 
   16735           0 :    }
   16736             : 
   16737             :

   17175             :

   17224             :           case tok_sharp:                 s = "#"; break;
   17225             :           case tok_paste:                 s = "##"; break;

   17227             :           case tok_gnu_min:               s = "<?"; break;
   17228             :           case tok_gnu_max:               s = ">?"; break;
   17229             : #if ENABLE_CUDA_SUPPORT

   17235             :           case tok_shared:                s = "__shared__"; break;

   17239             :        // Punctuators (standard, 3.1.6) that are not also operators:
   17240             :           case tok_lbrace:                s = "{"; break;
   17241             :           case tok_rbrace:                s = "}"; break;
   17242             :           case tok_semicolon:             s = ";"; break;
   17243             :           case tok_ellipsis:              s = "..."; break;
